Group Project - CE903¶

Fact Checking by using Wikipedia¶

Submitted by Group 6¶

First version and Final Version (Excluding the Google Translation Part)¶

  • Extract facts from wikipedia pages

Automatically Identification and Extraction of Facts (Statements) from a Wikipedia Page.¶

Required package¶

  • In order to run the below-mentioned code below packages are mandetory

    • spacy
    • textacy

  • To install spacy please go through the below page

    • https://spacy.io/usage/

  • For linux/ubuntu

    • $pip install -U spacy

  • To install textacy go through the below-mentioned links

    • https://pypi.org/project/textacy/
    • https://media.readthedocs.org/pdf/textacy/stable/textacy.pdf
In [1]:
import nltk, re, requests
import spacy
import textacy.extract
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
from nltk import pos_tag, ne_chunk
from spacy import displacy

spacy_eng_nlp_model = spacy.load('en_core_web_lg')
In [2]:
# Grab a perticular page from online wikipedia.

wiki_page = "Brexit"
extract_link = f"https://en.wikipedia.org/api/rest_v1/page/html/{wiki_page}"
#extract_link = f"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/{wiki_page}"
In [3]:
raw_data = requests.get(extract_link)
In [4]:
bsoup = BeautifulSoup(raw_data.text, "lxml")
extracted_text = bsoup.select("body")[0].get_text().strip()
In [5]:
# Identification of extraction of statement (can be treat as a fact) by using textacy.

texts = spacy_eng_nlp_model(extracted_text)
statements = textacy.extract.semistructured_statements(texts, wiki_page)
statements = list(statements)

print (statements)

[(Brexit, be, a factor for the slowdown in EU immigration), (Brexit, was, a warning for the EU), (Brexit, may be, good for terrorists and the Kremlin and bad for European security), (Brexit, is, only alternative to Chequers plan), (Brexit, are, the options), (Brexit, are, the options)]
In [6]:
#Process the text and strip out the [] from the text

def processing(txt):
    reg_exp = re.compile("\.?\[\d+\]?")
    txt = reg_exp.sub("", txt).strip()
    
    if txt[-1] == ".":
        txt = txt[0:-1]
        
    return txt
In [7]:
# Extract the fact

for fact_wiki in statements:
    subject, verb, fact = fact_wiki
    fact = processing(str(fact))
    print(f"{subject} {verb} {fact}.")

Brexit be a factor for the slowdown in EU immigration.
Brexit was a warning for the EU.
Brexit may be good for terrorists and the Kremlin and bad for European security.
Brexit is only alternative to Chequers plan.
Brexit are the options.
Brexit are the options.
In [8]:
for named_entity in texts.ents:
    print(f"{named_entity.text} ({named_entity.label_})")

Timetable for the exit process, December 2018 DATE Brexit FAC (/brkst, brzt/; a portmanteau of " British NORP " and "exit") is the withdrawal of the United Kingdom GPE ( UK GPE ) from the European Union ORG ( EU ORG ), which is scheduled to take place on 29 March 2019 DATE at 11 CARDINAL pm UK GPE time,[1][2] when the period for negotiating a Withdrawal Agreement will end unless an extension is agreed.[3] There is an ongoing debate about leaving with a Withdrawal Agreement LAW that has been ratified by both parties as an international treaty between UK GPE and EU GPE or leaving with no such treaty. On 14 March 2019 DATE , the House of Commons ORG voted by a majority of 211 CARDINAL votes for the Prime Minister, Theresa May PERSON , to ask the EU ORG for such an extension of the period allowed for the negotiation.[4] Brexit ORG follows the referendum of 23 June 2016 DATE when 51.9 per cent MONEY of voters chose to leave the EU ORG . Withdrawal GPE has been advocated by Eurosceptics ORG , both left-wing and right-wing,[5][6][7] while pro- Europeanists GPE , who also span the political spectrum, have advocated continued membership.
The UK GPE joined the European Communities ORG ( EC ORG ) in 1973 DATE under the Conservative government of Edward Heath PERSON , with continued membership endorsed by a referendum in 1975 DATE . From the 1990s DATE , opposition to further European NORP integration came mainly from the right, and divisions within the Conservative Party ORG led to rebellion over the Maastricht Treaty LAW in 1992 DATE .
The new UK Independence Party ORG ( UKIP ORG ) was a major advocate of a further referendum on continued membership of what had now become the European Union ORG , and the party's growing popularity in the early 2010s DATE resulted in UKIP ORG being the most successful UK GPE party in the 2014 DATE European Parliament ORG election. The cross-party People's Pledge ORG campaign was also influential in bringing about a referendum. The Conservative Prime Minister David Cameron PERSON pledged during the campaign for the 2015 DATE UK GPE General Election to hold a new referenduma promise which he fulfilled in 2016 DATE following the pressure from the Eurosceptic NORP wing of his party. Cameron PERSON , who had campaigned to remain, resigned after the result and was succeeded by Theresa ORG May DATE , his former Home Secretary. She called a snap general election less than a year later DATE , but lost her overall majority. Her minority government is supported in key votes by the Democratic Unionist Party ORG .
On 29 March 2017 DATE , the Government of the United Kingdom GPE invoked Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union LAW . May DATE announced the government's intention not to seek permanent membership of the European NORP single market or the EU ORG customs union after leaving the EU[8][9 NORP ] and promised to repeal the European Communities Act LAW of 1972 DATE and incorporate existing European Union ORG law into UK GPE domestic law.[10 GPE ] Negotiations with the EU ORG officially started in June 2017 DATE , aiming to complete the withdrawal agreement by October 2018 DATE . In June 2018 DATE , the UK GPE and the EU ORG published a joint progress report outlining agreement on issues including customs, VAT GPE and Euratom PERSON . In November 2018 DATE , the Draft Withdrawal Agreement EVENT and Outline Political Declaration LAW , agreed between the UK Government ORG and the EU ORG , was published.[11] On 15 January 2019 DATE , the House of Commons ORG voted 432 CARDINAL to 202 CARDINAL against the deal, the largest parliamentary defeat in history for a sitting UK GPE government.[12][13] A second ORDINAL vote on 12 March DATE was voted against 391 CARDINAL to 242 CARDINAL , a loss of 149 CARDINAL votes, 81 CARDINAL less than the vote in January.[14 LOC ]
The broad consensus among economists is that Brexit ORG will likely reduce the UK GPE 's real per capita income in the medium term and long term,[15][16 ORG ] and that the Brexit GPE referendum itself had damaged the economy.[17] Studies on effects since the referendum show a reduction in GDP, trade and investment, as well as household losses from increased inflation.[18][19][20][21] Brexit ORG is likely to reduce immigration from European Economic Area ORG ( EEA ORG ) countries to the UK,[22] and poses challenges for UK GPE higher education and academic research.[23] As of November 2018[update TIME ], the size of the "divorce bill"the UK GPE 's inheritance of existing EU ORG trade agreementsand relations with Ireland GPE and other EU ORG member states remains uncertain. The precise impact on the UK GPE depends on whether the process will be a "hard" or "soft" Brexit FAC . Analysis by HM Treasury ORG has found that there is no Brexit FAC scenario that is expected to improve the UK GPE economic condition.[24]

Campaigning in the United Kingdom European Union ORG membership referendum European Union Issues ORG in the United Kingdom European Union GPE membership referendum Opinion ORG polling for the United Kingdom European Union ORG membership referendum Endorsements PRODUCT in the United Kingdom European Union ORG membership referendum International ORG reactions to the 2016 DATE United Kingdom European Union ORG membership referendum Activism Britain Stronger in Europe Labour MONEY In for Britain GPE

Brexit: The Movie Postcards ORG from the 48% PERCENT

Proposed second ORDINAL Scottish NORP independence referendum Higher PERCENT categories: European NORP politics, United Kingdom Category GPE : Brexit PERSON vte Main ORG articles: History of European Union ORG United Kingdom GPE relations and Foreign relations of the United Kingdom GPE
The " Inner Six WORK_OF_ART " European NORP countries signed the Treaty of Paris LAW in 1951 DATE , establishing the European Coal and Steel Community ORG ( ECSC ORG ). The 1955 DATE Messina Conference EVENT deemed that the ECSC ORG was a success, and resolved to extend the concept further, thereby leading to the 1957 DATE Treaties of Rome GPE establishing the European Economic Community ORG ( EEC ORG ) and the European Atomic Energy Community (Euratom ORG ). In 1967 DATE , these became known as the European Communities ORG ( EC ORG ). The UK GPE attempted to join in 1963 DATE and 1967 DATE , but these applications were vetoed by the President of France GPE , Charles de Gaulle.[25 PERSON ] After de Gaulle PERSON relinquished the French NORP presidency, the UK GPE successfully applied for membership and the Conservative NORP prime minister Edward Heath PERSON signed the Treaty of Accession LAW in 1972.[26 CARDINAL ] Parliament ORG passed the European Communities Act ORG later that year[27] and the UK GPE joined Denmark GPE and Ireland GPE in becoming a member of the EC ORG on 1 January 1973.[28 DATE ]
The opposition Labour Party ORG won the February 1974 DATE general election without a majority and then contested the subsequent October 1974 DATE general election with a commitment to renegotiate Britain GPE 's terms of membership of the EC ORG , believing them to be unfavourable, and then hold a referendum on whether to remain in the EC ORG on the new terms.[29] Labour again won the election (this time with a small majority), and in 1975 DATE the United Kingdom GPE held its first ORDINAL ever national referendum, asking whether the UK GPE should remain in the European Communities ORG . Despite significant division within the ruling Labour Party,[30 LOC ] all major political parties and the mainstream press supported continuing membership of the EC ORG . On 5 June 1975 DATE , 67.2 per cent MONEY of the electorate and all but two[31] UK GPE counties and regions voted to stay in;[32] support for the UK GPE to leave the EC ORG in 1975 DATE appears unrelated to the support for Leave in the 2016 DATE referendum.[33]
Comparison of results of 1975 DATE and 2016 DATE referendums
The Labour Party ORG campaigned in the 1983 DATE general election on a commitment to withdraw from the EC ORG without a referendum,[34 GPE ] although after a heavy defeat Labour changed its policy.[34] In 1985 DATE , the Thatcher PERSON government ratified the Single European Act LAW the first ORDINAL major revision to the Treaty of Rome LAW without a referendum.
In October 1990 DATE , under pressure from senior ministers and despite Margaret Thatcher's PERSON deep reservations, the United Kingdom GPE joined the European Exchange Rate Mechanism ORG (ERM), with the pound sterling pegged to the deutschmark. Thatcher PERSON resigned as Prime Minister the following month DATE , amid Conservative Party ORG divisions arising partly from her increasingly Eurosceptic NORP views. The United Kingdom GPE and Italy GPE were forced to withdraw from the ERM ORG in September 1992 DATE , after the pound sterling and the lira came under pressure from currency speculation (" Black Wednesday").[35 LOC ]
Under the Maastricht Treaty LAW , the European Communities ORG became the European Union ORG on 1 November 1993,[36 DATE ] reflecting the evolution of the organisation from an economic union into a political union.[37] Denmark GPE , France GPE , and Ireland GPE held referendums to ratify the Maastricht Treaty LAW . In accordance with British NORP constitutional convention, specifically that of parliamentary sovereignty, ratification in the UK GPE was not subject to approval by referendum. Despite this, the British NORP constitutional historian Vernon Bogdanor PERSON wrote at the time that there was "a clear constitutional rationale for requiring a referendum" because although MPs are entrusted with legislative power by the electorate, they are not given authority to transfer that power (the UK GPE 's previous three CARDINAL referendums all concerned the transfer of parliamentary powers). Further, as the ratification of the treaty was in the manifestos of the three CARDINAL major political parties, voters opposed to ratification had no way to express that opposition. For Bogdanor ORG , while the ratification of the treaty by the House of Commons ORG might be legal, it would not be legitimatewhich requires popular consent. The way in which the treaty was ratified, he judged, was "likely to have fundamental consequences both for British NORP politics and for Britain GPE 's relationship with the European NORP Community.[38][39] This perceived democratic deficit directly led to the formation of the Referendum Party ORG and the United Kingdom Independence Party ORG .
Referendum Party ORG and UKIP
In 1994 DATE , Sir James Goldsmith PERSON formed the Referendum Party ORG to contest the 1997 DATE general election on a platform of providing a referendum on the nature of the United Kingdom's GPE relationship with the EU.[40][41] The party fielded candidates in 547 CARDINAL constituencies at that election, and won 810,860 CARDINAL votes2.6 per cent of the total votes cast[42]but failed to win a parliamentary seat due to the vote being spread across the country. The Referendum Party ORG disbanded after Goldsmith PERSON 's death in 1997 DATE .
The UK Independence Party ORG ( UKIP ORG ), a Eurosceptic NORP political party, was also formed in 1993 DATE . It achieved third ORDINAL place in the UK GPE during the 2004 DATE European NORP elections, second ORDINAL place in the 2009 DATE European NORP elections and first ORDINAL place in the 2014 DATE European NORP elections, with 27.5 per cent MONEY of the total vote. This was the first ORDINAL time since the 1910 DATE general election that any party other than Labour ORG or the Conservatives NORP had taken the largest share of the vote in a nationwide election.[43] UKIP ORG 's electoral success in the 2014 DATE European NORP election is documented as the strongest correlate of the support for the leave campaign in the 2016 DATE referendum.[44]
UKIP won two CARDINAL by-elections (triggered by defecting Conservative MPs) in 2014 DATE ; in the 2015 DATE general election, the party took 12.6 per cent MONEY of the total vote and held one CARDINAL of the two CARDINAL seats won in 2014.[45 CARDINAL ]
Opinion polls 19772015 Main ORG article: Opinion polling for the United Kingdom European Union ORG membership referendum ORG Both pro- and anti- EU ORG views have had majority support at different times since 1977.[46] In the European Communities ORG membership referendum of 1975 DATE , two-thirds CARDINAL of British NORP voters favoured continued EC ORG membership.
In a statistical analysis published in April 2016 DATE , Professor John Curtice PERSON of Strathclyde University ORG defined Euroscepticism as the wish to sever or reduce the powers of the EU ORG and, conversely, Europhilia PERSON as the desire to preserve or increase the powers of the EU ORG . According to this definition, the British Social Attitudes (BSA ORG ) surveys showed an increase in Euroscepticism from 38 per cent MONEY , in 1993 DATE , to 65 per cent MONEY in 2015 DATE . Euroscepticism should, however, not be confused with the wish to leave the EU ORG : the BSA ORG survey for the period JulyNovember 2015 DATE showed that 60 per cent MONEY backed the option to continue as an EU ORG member and 30 per cent MONEY backed the option to withdraw.[47] Referendum of ORG 2016 DATE Main ORG article: 2016 DATE United Kingdom European Union ORG membership referendum Negotiations ORG for EU ORG reform Main ORG article: United Kingdom GPE renegotiation of European Union ORG membership, 201516 CARDINAL
In 2012 DATE , Prime Minister David Cameron PERSON initially rejected calls for a referendum on the UK GPE 's EU membership,[48 FAC ] but then suggested the possibility of a future referendum to endorse his proposed renegotiation of Britain GPE 's relationship with the EU.[49 ORG ] According to the BBC ORG , "The prime minister acknowledged the need to ensure the UK GPE 's [renegotiated] position within the European Union ORG had 'the full-hearted support of the British NORP people' but they needed to show 'tactical and strategic patience'."[50] On 23 January 2013 DATE , under pressure from many of his MPs and from the rise of UKIP ORG , Cameron PERSON announced that a Conservative NORP government would hold an in-or-out referendum on EU ORG membership before the end of 2017 DATE , on a renegotiated package, if elected in the 7 May 2015 DATE general election.[51] This was included in the Conservative Party ORG manifesto for the election.[52][53]
The Conservative Party ORG won the election with a majority. Soon afterwards, the European Union Referendum Act ORG 2015 DATE was introduced into Parliament ORG to enable the referendum. Cameron PERSON favoured remaining in a reformed European Union ORG , and sought to renegotiate on four CARDINAL key points: protection of the single market for non-eurozone countries, reduction of "red tape", exempting Britain GPE from "ever-closer union", and restricting EU ORG immigration.[54]
In December 2015 DATE , opinion polls showed a clear majority in favour of remaining in the EU ORG ; they also showed support would drop if Cameron PERSON did not negotiate adequate safeguards for non-eurozone member states, and restrictions on benefits for EU ORG citizens.[55]
The outcome of the renegotiations was announced in February 2016 DATE . Some limits to in-work benefits for new EU ORG immigrants were agreed, but before they could be applied, a country such as the UK GPE would have to get permission from the European Commission ORG and then from the European Council.[56 ORG ]
In a speech to the House of Commons ORG on 22 February 2016 DATE , Cameron PERSON announced a referendum date of 23 June 2016 DATE , and commented on the renegotiation settlement.[57] He spoke of an intention to trigger the Article 50 process LAW immediately following a leave vote, and of the " two-year DATE time period to negotiate the arrangements for exit."[58]
The agreed referendum question was "Should the United Kingdom GPE remain a member of the European Union ORG or leave the European Union ORG ?"
Campaign groups Main ORG article: Campaigning in the 2016 DATE United Kingdom European Union ORG membership referendum A " ORG Vote Leave" poster in Omagh GPE , Northern Ireland GPE , saying "We send the EU ORG 50million MONEY every day. Let's spend it on our NHS ORG instead."
The official campaign group for leaving the EU ORG was Vote Leave[59] after a contest for the designation with Leave.EU.[60][61]
The official campaign to stay in the EU ORG , chaired by Stuart Rose PERSON , was known as Britain Stronger PERSON in Europe LOC , or informally as 'Remain'. Other campaigns supporting remaining in the EU ORG included Conservatives NORP In,[62] Labour in for Britain,[63] #INtogether (Liberal Democrats),[64] Greens NORP for a Better Europe,[65] Scientists for EU,[66 ORG ] Environmentalists For Europe,[67] Universities for Europe[68] and Another Europe LOC is Possible.[69]
Referendum result
Main article: Results of the 2016 DATE United Kingdom European Union ORG membership referendum
The result was announced on the morning of TIME 24 June DATE : 51.89 CARDINAL per cent voted in favour of leaving the European Union ORG , and 48.11 per cent MONEY voted in favour of remaining a member of the European NORP Union.[70][71] Comprehensive results are available from the UK Electoral Commission Referendum ORG Results site. A petition calling for a second ORDINAL referendum attracted more than four million signatures,[72][73 MONEY ] but was rejected by the government on 9 July.[74 LOC ]

Leave
Remain
Demographic analysis of voters
According to researchers based at the University of Warwick ORG and affiliated with the Centre for Competitive Advantage ORG in the Global Economy LOC , areas with "deprivation in terms of education, income and employment were more likely to vote Leave". The Leave vote tended to be greater in areas which had lower incomes and high unemployment, a strong tradition of manufacturing employment, and in which the population had fewer qualifications.[75] It also tended to be greater where there was a larger flow of Eastern European LOC migrants (mainly low-skilled workers) into areas with larger shares of native low-skilled workers.[75] Those in lower social grades (especially the 'working class') were more likely to vote Leave, while those in higher social grades (especially the 'upper middle class') more likely to vote Remain.[76]
According to Thomas Sampson PERSON , an economist at the London School of Economics ORG , "Older and less-educated voters were more likely to vote 'leave' [...] A majority of white voters wanted to leave, but only 33 CARDINAL per cent of Asian NORP voters and 27 CARDINAL per cent of black voters chose leave. There was no gender split in the vote [...] Leaving the European Union ORG received support from across the political spectrum [...] Voting to leave the European Union ORG was strongly associated with holding socially conservative political beliefs, opposing cosmopolitanism, and thinking life in Britain GPE is getting worse rather than better".[16] Econometric studies show that "education and, to a lesser extent, age were the strongest demographic predictors of voting behavior". Support for leaving was linked with "poor economic outcomes at the individual or area level" and with "self-reported opposition to immigration, but not with exposure to immigration".[16]
Resignations, contests, and appointments Main ORG article: Aftermath of the WORK_OF_ART 2016 DATE United Kingdom European Union ORG membership referendum After ORG the result was declared, Cameron PERSON announced that he would resign by October.[77] He stood down on 13 CARDINAL July 2016 DATE , with Theresa ORG May DATE becoming Prime Minister after a leadership contest. George Osborne PERSON was replaced as Chancellor of the Exchequer ORG by Philip Hammond PERSON , former Mayor of London GPE Boris Johnson PERSON was appointed Secretary of State ORG for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs, and David Davis PERSON became Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union ORG . Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn PERSON lost a vote of confidence among his parliamentary party, and an unsuccessful leadership challenge was launched. On 4 July DATE , Nigel Farage PERSON announced his resignation as leader of UKIP.[78 GPE ]
Irregularities
See also: Russian NORP interference in the 2016 DATE Brexit ORG referendum
Irregularities have been alleged in the conduct of the referendum campaign.
On 11 CARDINAL May 2018 DATE , the Electoral Commission ORG found against Leave. EU ORG , which ran a separate campaign to the official pro- Brexit FAC group Vote Leave, following its investigations into alleged irregularities during the referendum campaign.[79] Leave. EU ORG 's co-founder Arron Banks PERSON has stated that he rejects the outcome of the investigation and will be challenging it in court.[80]
In July 2018 DATE , the UK Electoral Commission ORG found Vote Leave to have broken electoral law, spending over its limit.[81] Also, the House of Commons Culture ORG , Media and Sport Select Committee ORG released an interim report on Disinformation and fake news ORG , stating that the largest donor in the Brexit ORG campaign, Arron Banks PERSON , had "failed to satisfy" the Committee ORG that his donations came from UK GPE sources, and may have been financed by the Russian NORP government.[82] Litigation ORG There has been litigation to explore the constitutional footings on which Brexit ORG stands after the Miller PERSON case and the 2017 DATE Notification Act LAW :
In R. NORP ( Webster PERSON ) v Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union ORG , the High Court ORG of Justice determined that the decision to leave the EU ORG was an executive decision of the Prime Minister using a statutory power of decision found to have been delegated to her by the Notification Act.[bettersourceneeded] This case was criticised academically,[83 NORP ] and it is also subject to an appeal.[84]
The confirmation that the decision was an executive act was part of the basis of R. NORP ( Wilson PERSON ) v. Prime Minister[85] the impact irregularities in the referendum, which is the basis for the executive decision to leave, is being challenged, with a hearing on 7 December 2018.[clarification DATE needed][86] Regarding PRODUCT the reversibility of a notification under Article 50, Wightman LAW and others v Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union ORG was referred to Court of Justice ORG of the European Union;[87 ORG ] the UK GPE government sought to block this referral, taking the matter on appeal to the UK Supreme Court ORG , but was unsuccessful.[88] On 10 December 2018 DATE , the Court of Justice ORG of the European Union ORG ruled that the UK GPE could unilaterally revoke its Article 50 notification.[89] LAW
Timing and procedure for leaving the EU Main PRODUCT article: United Kingdom GPE invocation of Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union Letter LAW from Theresa ORG May DATE invoking Article 50 Procedure Withdrawal LAW from the European Union ORG is governed by Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union LAW . Under the Article LAW 50 CARDINAL invocation procedure, a member notifies the European Council ORG , whereupon the EU ORG is required to "negotiate and conclude an agreement with [the leaving] State, setting out the arrangements for its withdrawal, taking account of the framework for its future relationship with the [ European NORP ] Union". The negotiation period is limited to two years DATE unless extended, after which the treaties cease to apply.[90] There was a discussion whether parallel negotiation of withdrawal terms and future relationships under Article 50 LAW are appropriate (Chancellor Merkel PERSON 's initial view) or whether Britain GPE did not have the right to negotiate future trade with the EU27 ORG as this power is arguably reserved to the EU ORG as long as the UK GPE is a member (the view of a European NORP Commission lawyer).[91 PERSON ]
Although the 2015 Referendum Act did not expressly require Article 50 to be invoked,[92 PERSON ] the UK GPE government stated that it would expect a leave vote to be followed by withdrawal.[93][94] Following the referendum result, Cameron PERSON resigned and said that it would be for the incoming Prime Minister to invoke Article 50.[95][96] LAW
The Supreme Court ORG ruled in the Miller PERSON case in January 2017 DATE that the government needed parliamentary approval to trigger Article 50.[97][98] LAW Subsequently, the House of Commons ORG overwhelmingly voted, on 1 February 2017 DATE , for a government bill authorising the prime minister to notify an intention to leave under Article 50,[99 CARDINAL ] and the bill passed into law as the European Union (Notification of Withdrawal) Act ORG 2017 DATE . Theresa ORG May DATE then signed a letter invoking Article 50 on 28 LAW March 2017 DATE , which was delivered on 29 March DATE by Tim Barrow PERSON , the UK GPE 's ambassador to the EU ORG , to European Council ORG President Donald PERSON Tusk.[100][101][102]
It had been argued that the Article 50 withdrawal process LAW could be halted unilaterally by the British NORP government,[103] with which opinion the author of Article 50 CARDINAL itself, Lord Kerr PERSON , expressed agreement.[104] The European Parliament's ORG Brexit GPE committee said that unilateral revocation, regardless of its legality, poses a substantial moral hazard, with an EU ORG member state potentially able to abuse it to blackmail the Union.[105 GPE ]
The reversibility of notifications under Article 50 LAW was subject to litigation, which a cross-party group of Scottish NORP politicians and the Good Law Project ORG referred to the Court of Justice ORG of the European Union.[106 ORG ] The UK GPE government sought to block this referral, ultimately in the UK Supreme Court ORG , but it was unsuccessful in this attempt.[107] On 10 December 2018 DATE , the ECJ PRODUCT ruled that a country could unilaterally cancel its withdrawal from the EU ORG , by simple notice, provided that it did so prior to actual departure, unconditionally and in good faith.[108] However the Government ORG 's immediate response was that it had no intention of exercising that right.[108]
Date and time of leaving Wikisource ORG has original text related to this article:
The Withdrawal Clause
Both parties to the withdrawal negotiation are bound by Article 50 (3) of the Treaty LAW , which states explicitly that the EU ORG treaties will cease to apply "from the date of entry into force of the withdrawal agreement or, failing that, two years DATE after" the withdrawal notification unless the EU Council ORG and UK GPE agree to extend the two-year DATE period.[109]
The European Union (Withdrawal) Act ORG 2018 DATE , in section 20 CARDINAL ( 1 CARDINAL ), defines the leaving time as 23:00 TIME on 29 March 2019 DATE GMT ( UTC+0 PERSON ) which is 00:00 CARDINAL on 30 March 2019 DATE CET in Brussels GPE (subject to possible modification resulting from a withdrawal agreement or an agreed prolongation of the negotiation period).[110][111][109][112][113]
Negotiations
Main article: Brexit ORG negotiations
Timing
The British NORP and EU ORG negotiators agreed that initial negotiations, relating especially to residency rights, would commence in June 2017 DATE (immediately after the French NORP presidential and parliamentary elections), and full negotiations, relating especially to trading agreements, could commence in October 2017 DATE (immediately after the German NORP federal election, 2017).[114][115][116 CARDINAL ] The first day DATE of talks was 19 CARDINAL June.[115] History WORK_OF_ART On 28 June 2016 DATE , Chancellor of Germany GPE Angela Merkel PERSON , and on the following day European Council ORG President Tusk PERSON , stated that the UK GPE could remain in the European Single Market ORG ( ESM ORG ) only if the UK GPE accepted its four CARDINAL freedoms of movement: for goods, capital, services, and labour.[117] In October DATE , Prime Minister Theresa PERSON May emphasised that ending the jurisdiction of EU GPE law and free movement from Europe LOC were the UK GPE 's priorities, along with British NORP and EU ORG companies having maximum freedom to trade in the UK GPE and the ESM.[118][119]
In November 2016 DATE , May DATE proposed that Britain GPE and the other EU ORG countries mutually guarantee the residency rights of the 3.3million QUANTITY EU GPE migrants in Britain GPE and those of the 1.2million CARDINAL British NORP migrants living in other countries of the EU ORG , in order to exclude their fates being bargained during Brexit GPE negotiations.[120] Despite initial approval from a majority of EU ORG states, May DATE 's proposal was blocked by Tusk and Merkel.[121 ORG ]
In January 2017 DATE , the Prime Minister presented 12 CARDINAL negotiating objectives and confirmed that the UK GPE government would not seek permanent single market membership.[122] The European Parliament's ORG lead negotiator Guy Verhofstadt PERSON responded that there could be no "cherry-picking" by the UK GPE in the talks.[123]
The statutory period for negotiation began on 29 March 2017 DATE , when the UK GPE formally submitted a letter notifying withdrawal. The letter called for a "deep and special relationship" between the UK GPE and the EU GPE , and warned that failure to reach an agreement would result in EU GPE - UK GPE trade under World Trade Organization ORG terms, and a weakening of the UK GPE 's co-operation in the fight against crime and terrorism. The letter suggested prioritising an early deal on the rights of EU ORG citizens in the UK GPE and vice versa, and stated that the UK GPE would not seek to remain within the ESM ORG . Instead, the UK GPE would seek a free trade agreement with the EU.[124] In response, Merkel PERSON insisted that the EU ORG would not discuss future co-operation without first ORDINAL settling the terms of leaving the EU ORG ; Verhofstadt PERSON referred to the letter as "blackmail" with regard to the point on security and terrorism, and EU Commission ORG president Jean-Claude Juncker PERSON said the UK GPE 's decision to quit the bloc was a "choice they will regret one CARDINAL day".[125]
On 29 April 2017 DATE , immediately after the first ORDINAL round of French NORP presidential elections, the EU27 heads of state accepted negotiating guidelines prepared by Tusk.[126] The guidelines take the view that Article 50 permits a LAW two CARDINAL -phased negotiation, in which the UK GPE first ORDINAL agrees to a financial commitment and to lifelong benefits for EU ORG citizens in Britain GPE , and then negotiations on a future relationship can begin.[127] In the first ORDINAL phase, the EU27 would demand the UK GPE pay a "divorce bill", initially estimated as amounting to 52bn[128 MONEY ] and then, after additional financial demands from Germany GPE , France GPE , and Poland GPE , to 92bn.[129 PERSON ] A report of the European Union Committee ORG of the House of Lords ORG , published on 4 March 2017 DATE , stated that if there is no post- Brexit ORG deal at the end of the negotiating period, the UK GPE could withdraw without payment.[130]
On 22 May 2017 DATE , the European Council ORG authorised its negotiators to start the Brexit FAC talks and it adopted its negotiating directives.[131] The first day DATE of talks took place on 19 June DATE , where Davis PERSON and Michel Barnier PERSON , European NORP Chief Negotiator for Brexit GPE , agreed to prioritise the question of residency rights, while Davis PERSON conceded that a discussion of the Northern Irish NORP border would have to await future trade agreements.[132]
On 22 June 2017 DATE , Prime Minister May guaranteed that no EU ORG citizen living legally in the UK GPE would be forced to leave, and offered that any EU GPE citizen who lived in the UK GPE for more than five years DATE until an unspecified deadline between March 2017 and March 2019 DATE would enjoy the same rights as a UK GPE citizen, conditional on the EU ORG providing the same offer to British NORP citizens living legally in the EU.[133] The Prime Minister detailed her residency proposals on 26 June DATE , but drew no concessions from EU ORG negotiators,[134] who had declined to expedite agreement on expatriates by the end of June 2017,[135 DATE ] and who are hoping for European NORP courts to continue to have jurisdiction in the UK GPE with regards to EU GPE citizens, according to their negotiation aims published in May 2017.[136][137 DATE ]
The second ORDINAL round of negotiations began in mid-July 2017 DATE . Progress PRODUCT was made on the Northern Irish NORP border question; UK GPE negotiators requested a detailed breakdown of the "divorce bill" demand; and the EU ORG negotiators criticised the UK GPE 's citizenship rights offer.[138 PERSON ] David Davis PERSON did not commit to a net payment by the UK GPE to the EU GPE with regards to the requested divorce bill, while Michel Barnier PERSON would not compromise on his demand for the European Court of Justice ORG to have continuing jurisdiction over the rights of EU ORG citizens living in the UK GPE after Brexit,[139] rejecting the compromise proposal of a new international body made up of British NORP and EU ORG judges.[140]
On 16 August 2017 DATE , the UK GPE government disclosed the first ORDINAL of several papers detailing British NORP ambitions following Brexit GPE , discussing trade and customs arrangements.[141] On 23 August DATE , Theresa ORG May DATE announced that Britain GPE will leave the EU Court of Justice's ORG direct jurisdiction when the Brexit GPE transition period that is planned after March 2019 DATE ends, but that both the British NORP courts and the EU Court of Justice ORG will also keep " half CARDINAL an eye" on each other's rulings afterwards as well.[142] One CARDINAL of the UK GPE government's position papers published in August DATE called for no additional restrictions for goods already on the market in the UK GPE and EU.[143]
The third ORDINAL round of negotiations began on 28 August 2017 DATE . There was disagreement over the financial settlement; The Irish Times ORG explained that British NORP negotiators referred to the seven-year DATE Multiannual Financial Framework ORG ( MFF NORP or Maff GPE ) for the period 20142020 GPE agreed by member states and the EU ORG parliament as a "planning tool" for the next period DATE rather than a legally-binding financial obligation on member states. The British NORP case is that the MFF ORG sets ceilings on spending under various headings and is later radically revised during the annual DATE budget process when real legal obligations on each state arises. This contrasts with the EU Commission's ORG methodology for calculating the UK GPE Brexit FAC bill which involves dividing the MFF ORG into the shares historically agreed by each member state.[144] On the Irish NORP border question there was a "breakthrough", with the British NORP side guaranteeing free movement of EU GPE citizens within the Common travel area constituting Ireland GPE and the United Kingdom.[145]
On 5 September 2017 DATE , Davis PERSON said that "concrete progress" had been made over the summer DATE in areas such as protecting the rights of British NORP expats in the EU ORG to access healthcare and over the future of the Irish NORP border, while significant differences over the "divorce bill" remained.[146] On 9 September DATE , the EU Commission ORG published several negotiating papers, including one in which the EU ORG concedes/declares that it is the responsibility of the UK GPE to propose solutions for the post- Brexit Irish FAC border. The paper envisages that a "unique" solution would be permissible here; in other words, any such exceptional Irish NORP solution would not necessarily be a template for post- Brexit GPE relationships with the other EU ORG members.[147]
On 22 September 2017 DATE , May DATE announced further details of her Brexit proposal.[148][149] In addition to offering 20billion euros MONEY over a two-year DATE transition period and continued acceptance of European NORP immigrants,[150] she also offered a "bold new security relationship" with the EU ORG which would be "unprecedented in its depth" and to continue to make "an ongoing contribution" to projects considered greatly to the EU GPE and UK GPE 's advantage, such as science and security projects.[149][148] She also confirmed that the UK GPE would not "stand in the way" of Juncker ORG 's proposals for further EU ORG integration.[149][148] Barnier PERSON welcomed May PERSON 's proposal as "constructive,"[151] but that it also "must be translated into negotiating positions to make meaningful progress".[151] Similarly, President of France GPE Emmanuel Macron PERSON was adamant that the EU ORG would not begin negotiations on future EU GPE - UK GPE relationships until "the regulation of European NORP citizens, the financial terms of the exit, and the questions of Ireland GPE " were "clarified" by the UK.[152]
The fourth ORDINAL round of talks began on 25 September DATE , with Barnier PERSON declaring he had no mandate from the EU27 to discuss a transition deal suggested by Prime Minister May. Davis PERSON reiterated that the UK GPE could honour commitments made during its EU ORG membership only in the context of a future "special partnership" deal with the EU.[153]
At the European Council ORG meeting of 19/20 October 2017 DATE , the 27 CARDINAL leaders of the EU ORG states were to decide whether or not to start trade negotiations with the UK.[143] However, Davis PERSON has conceded that so soon after the German NORP elections on 24 September DATE , a German NORP coalition government may not be in place in time for making this decision in October DATE , delaying any European Council ORG decision until their December DATE meeting.[154][155] EU ORG negotiators have stated that an agreement must be reached between Britain GPE and the EU ORG by October 2018 DATE in order to leave time for national parliaments to endorse Brexit.[151]
On 9 October 2017 DATE , May DATE announced to the British Parliament ORG that Britain GPE could operate as an "independent trading nation" after Brexit ORG if no trade deal is reached with the EU.[156]
In December 2017 DATE , EU ORG leaders announced an agreement to begin the next phase of negotiations, with talks on a transition period after March 2019 DATE to begin in early 2018 DATE and discussions on the future UK GPE -EU relationship, including trade and security, to begin in March.[157 FAC ]
On 10 June 2018 DATE , the Irish NORP Prime Minister Leo Varadkar PERSON cleared the path for the June DATE negotiations by postponing the Irish NORP border question until the final Brexit GPE deal in October 2018.[158 DATE ]
On 19 June 2018 DATE , the UK GPE and the EU ORG published a joint statement outlining agreements at the negotiators' level. Michel Barnier PERSON praised the "dedication and commitment" of the negotiating teams, and said progress had been made in issues like customs, VAT ORG and the European NORP nuclear agreement, Euratom.[159][160] PERSON On 12 July 2018 DATE , Prime Minister May PERSON and part of the cabinet published a proposal for agreement on future relations between UK GPE and EU GPE . It is by media called the Chequers ORG plan.
On 14 November 2018 DATE a lengthy meeting of the Cabinet ORG approved a Draft Withdrawal Agreement.[161][162] The following day DATE , Brexit ORG Secretary Dominic Raab PERSON , his Cabinet ORG colleague Esther McVey PERSON and several junior ministers resigned their posts because of their disagreement with the contents of the document.[163]
On 19 December 2018 DATE the EU Commission ORG announced its "no-deal" Contingency Action Plan WORK_OF_ART in specific sectors, in respect of the UK GPE leaving the European Union ORG "in 100 days' DATE time."[164] Post ORG Article 50 CARDINAL British NORP legislation European Union (Withdrawal ORG ) Act 2018 DATE Main ORG article: European Union (Withdrawal) Act ORG 2018
In October 2016 DATE , Theresa May PERSON promised a " Great Repeal Bill WORK_OF_ART ", which would repeal the European Communities Act LAW 1972 DATE and restate in UK GPE law all enactments previously in force under EU ORG law. Subsequently renamed the European Union (Withdrawal ORG ) bill, it was introduced to the House of Commons ORG on 13 July 2017.[165 DATE ]
On 12 September 2017 DATE , the bill passed its first ORDINAL vote and second ORDINAL reading by a margin of 326 CARDINAL votes to 290 CARDINAL votes in the House ORG of Commons.[166 ORG ] The bill was further amended on a series of votes in both Houses of Parliament ORG . After the Act LAW became law on 26 June 2018 DATE , the European Council ORG decided on 29 June DATE to renew its call on Member States and Union ORG institutions to step up their work on preparedness at all levels and for all outcomes.[167]
The Withdrawal Act LAW fixes the period ending 21 January 2019 DATE for the government to decide on how to proceed if the negotiations have not reached agreement in principle on both the withdrawal arrangements and the framework for the future relationship between the UK GPE and EU ORG ; while, alternatively, making future ratification of the withdrawal agreement as a treaty between the UK GPE and EU ORG depend upon the prior enactment of another act of Parliament ORG for approving the final terms of withdrawal when the current Brexit GPE negotiations are completed. In any event, the act does not alter the two-year DATE period for negotiating allowed by Article 50 LAW that ends at the latest on 29 March 2019 DATE if the UK GPE has not by then ratified a withdrawal agreement or agreed a prolongation of the negotiating period.[110]
The Withdrawal Act LAW which became law in June 2018 DATE allows for various outcomes including no negotiated settlement.
Additional government bills
A report published in March 2017 DATE by the Institute for Government ORG commented that, in addition to the European Union (Withdrawal ORG ) bill, primary and secondary legislation will be needed to cover the gaps in policy areas such as customs, immigration and agriculture.[168] The report also commented that the role of the devolved legislatures was unclear, and could cause problems, and as many as 15 CARDINAL new additional Brexit Bills ORG may be required, which would involve strict prioritisation and limiting Parliamentary WORK_OF_ART time for in-depth examination of new legislation.[169]
In 2016 DATE and 2017 DATE , the House of Lords ORG published a series of reports on Brexit GPE -related subjects, including:



Brexit FAC : the options for trade Brexit ORG : UK GPE -Irish relations
Brexit: future UK GPE -EU security and police cooperation Brexit GPE : fisheries Brexit FAC : environment and climate change Brexit ORG : the Crown Dependencies Brexit PRODUCT : justice for families, individuals and businesses?
Brexit: trade in non- financial services Euratom PERSON The Nuclear Safeguards Bill 201719, relating to withdrawal from Euratom PERSON , was presented to Parliament ORG in October 2017 DATE and began its Report Stage ORG in January 2018.[170 DATE ]
Voting on the final outcome
Replying to questions at a parliamentary committee about Parliament ORG 's involvement in voting on the outcome of the negotiations with the EU ORG , the Prime Minister said that "delivering on the vote of the British NORP people to leave the European Union ORG " was her priority. The shadow Brexit GPE secretary, Keir Starmer PERSON , commented that the government did not want a vote at the beginning of the process, to trigger Article 50 LAW , nor a vote at the end.[171] Developments ORG since the referendum of 2016 CARDINAL
Elections
Opinion polls in the fortnight DATE following the referendum suggested that the immediate reaction in the Netherlands GPE and other European NORP countries was a decline in support for Eurosceptic NORP movements.[172]
A general election was held on 8 June 2017 DATE , announced at short notice by the new Prime Minister Theresa PERSON May. DATE The Conservative Party, Labour ORG and UKIP ORG made manifesto pledges to implement the referendum, although the Labour ORG manifesto differed in its approach to Brexit GPE negotiations, such as unilaterally offering permanent residence to EU ORG immigrants.[173][174][175][176] The Liberal Democrat Party ORG and the Green Party ORG manifestos proposed a policy of remaining in the EU ORG via a second ORDINAL referendum.[177][178][179] The Scottish National Party ORG manifesto proposed a policy of waiting for the outcome of the Brexit FAC negotiations and then holding a referendum on Scottish NORP independence.[180][181] Compared to the 2015 DATE general election, the Conservatives NORP gained votes (but nevertheless lost seats and their majority in the House of Commons ORG ). Labour gained significantly on votes and seats, retaining its position as the second ORDINAL -largest party. The Democratic Unionist Party ORG (DUP) and Sinn Fin PERSON also made gains in votes and seats. Parties losing votes included the SNP ORG , Liberals NORP , Greens NORP , and especially UKIP.[182]
On 26 June 2017 DATE , Conservatives NORP and the DUP reached a confidence and supply agreement whereby the DUP would back the Conservatives NORP in key votes in the House of Commons ORG over the course of the parliament. The agreement included additional funding of 1billion MONEY for Northern Ireland GPE , highlighted mutual support for Brexit GPE and national security, expressed commitment to the Good Friday Agreement LAW , and indicated that policies such as the state pension triple lock and Winter Fuel Payments WORK_OF_ART would be maintained.[183]
Economy
Six weeks DATE after the referendum, the Bank of England ORG sought to cushion the potential shock to the economy by lowering interest rates to the record low of 0.25% PERCENT , introducing quantitative easing, and creating 70billion pounds MONEY of new money, thereby depreciating the pound sterling and encouraging commercial banks to pass on lower borrowing costs.[184]
A rise in inflation outpaced wage growth for most of 2017 DATE , with inflation gradually rising to 3% PERCENT , before receding again as a year-long DATE "wage squeeze" attributed to the referendum ended in February 2018 DATE and wage growth caught up with inflation. Since the referendum, absolute employment has continuously risen to previously unrecorded levels, and by early 2018 DATE relative unemployment reached its lowest level ( 4.2% PERCENT ) recorded since 1975.[185]
During 2017 DATE the UK GPE continued to be the favourite European NORP destination for foreign physical investment (as distinct from company takeovers), creating 50,000 CARDINAL new jobs, ahead of Germany GPE ( 31,000 CARDINAL jobs) and France GPE . Factors mentioned were sterling devaluation since the referendum, broadband, and American NORP investment.[186]
Immigration PERSON Official figures for June 2017 DATE (published in February 2018 DATE ) showed that net EU ORG immigration to the UK GPE had slowed to about 100,000 CARDINAL immigrants per year, corresponding to the immigration level of 2014 DATE . Meanwhile, immigration from non- EU ORG countries had increased. Taken together, the two CARDINAL inflows into the UK GPE result in an only slightly reduced net immigration of 230,000 CARDINAL newcomers in the year to June 2017 DATE . The Head of the Office of National Statistics ORG suggested that Brexit ORG could well be a factor for the slowdown in EU ORG immigration, but cautioned there might be other reasons.[187]
UK Government's legal advice
Following an unprecedented vote on 4 December 2018 DATE , MPs ruled that the UK GPE government was in contempt of parliament for refusing to provide to Parliament ORG , the full legal advice it had been given on the effect of its proposed terms for withdrawal.[188] The key point within the advice covered the legal effect of the "backstop" agreement governing Northern Ireland GPE , the Republic of Ireland GPE and the rest of the UK GPE , in regard to the customs border between the EU ORG and UK GPE , and its implications for the Good Friday DATE agreement which had led to the end of the Troubles in Northern Ireland GPE , and specifically, whether the UK GPE would be certain of being able to leave the EU ORG in a practical sense, under the draft proposals.
The following day, the advice was published. The question asked was, "What is the legal effect of the UK GPE agreeing to the Protocol LAW to the Withdrawal Agreement on Ireland GPE and Northern Ireland GPE in particular its effect in conjunction with Articles 5 CARDINAL and 184 CARDINAL of the main Withdrawal Agreement?" The advice given was that:[188]
The Protocol LAW is binding on the UK GPE and EU GPE [para 3 CARDINAL ], and anticipates a final future resolution of the border and customs issues being reached [para 5,12,13]. But "the Protocol LAW is intended to subsist even when negotiations have clearly broken down" [para 16 CARDINAL ] and "In conclusion, the current drafting of the Protocol LAW ... does not provide for a mechanism that is likely to enable the UK GPE lawfully to exit the UK GPE wide customs union without a subsequent agreement. This remains the case even if parties are still negotiating many years later DATE , and even if the parties believe that talks have clearly broken down and there is no prospect of a future relationship agreement." [para 30 CARDINAL ]
Delay of vote on Withdrawal Agreement ORG
On 10 December 2018 DATE , the Prime Minister postponed the vote in the House of Commons ORG on her Brexit ORG deal. The announcement came minutes TIME after the Prime Minister's Office confirmed the vote would be going ahead.[189] Faced with the prospect of a defeat in the House of Commons ORG , this option gave May DATE more time to negotiate with Conservative backbenchers and the EU GPE , even though they had ruled out further discussions.[190] The decision was met with calls from many Welsh NORP Labour MPs for a motion of no confidence in the Government.[191] The Leader of the Opposition, Jeremy Corbyn PERSON , described the government as being in "disarray".
The European Research Group ORG , the segment of the Conservative Party ORG that favours a "hard" Brexit FAC , opposes the Prime Minister's proposed Withdrawal Agreement ORG treaty. Its members strongly object to the Withdrawal Agreement's LAW inclusion of the Irish NORP backstop.[192][193] ERG ORG members also object to the proposed 39 billion MONEY financial settlement with the European Union ORG and state that the agreement would result in the UK GPE 's agreement to continuing to follow EU ORG regulations in major policy areas;and to the continuing jurisdiction of the European Court of Justice ORG over interpretation of the agreement and of European NORP law still applicable to the UK.[194][195]
Sir Ivan Rogers PERSON , the UK GPE ambassador to the EU ORG at the time of the 2016 DATE referendum, publicly commented on 13 December 2018 DATE that the EU ORG was always adroit at reframing things that have already been agreed, such as the Irish NORP backstop, in ways that "make the medicine slip down".[196] Vote on ORG Withdrawal Agreement
Main article: Meaningful vote PERSON On 15 January 2019 DATE , the House of Commons ORG voted 432 CARDINAL to 202 CARDINAL against the deal, which was the largest majority against a United Kingdom GPE government ever.[12][197][198] Soon after, a motion of no confidence in Her Majesty's Government ORG was tabled by the opposition,[199] which was rejected by 325 CARDINAL votes to 306.[200 CARDINAL ] Second ORG vote on Withdrawal Agreement ORG
Main article: Meaningful vote
On 24 February DATE , Theresa ORG May DATE announced that the next vote on the withdrawal agreement would be on 12 March DATE , just 17 days DATE away from Brexit.[201]
The deal was voted against 391 CARDINAL to 242 CARDINAL , a loss of 149 CARDINAL votes down from 230 CARDINAL from when the deal was proposed in January.[14]
Third vote on Withdrawal Agreement ORG
On 18 March 2019 DATE , the Speaker informed the House of Commons ORG that a third ORDINAL meaningful vote could only be held on a motion that was significantly different from the previous one DATE , citing parliamentary precedents going back to 1604.[202 CARDINAL ] Domestic ORG impact on the United Kingdom GPE
The Department for Exiting the European Union (DExEU) produced reports on the economic impact on 58 CARDINAL industries of Britain GPE leaving the EU ORG . The Labour Party ORG made a freedom of information request for details about the reports, but DExEU said that publishing the information would undermine policy formulation, and that it needed to carry out policymaking in a "safe space".[203] Labour then proposed a motion of a rarely-used type known as a "humble address" in the Commons on 1 November 2017 DATE , calling for the papers to be released; the motion was passed unanimously. The leader of the house, Andrea Leadsom PERSON , said that there could be some delay while ministers decided how to release the information without prejudicing Brexit FAC negotiations.[204]
Immigration Long PERSON -term impact KPMG ORG , based on a 2017 DATE survey of 2,000 CARDINAL EU ORG workers in the UK GPE , estimated that about a million CARDINAL EU GPE citizens working in the UK GPE saw their future in Britain GPE as over or hanging in the balance.[205]
A 2017 DATE paper by King's College London ORG economists Giuseppe Forte PERSON and Jonathan Portes PERSON found that "while future migration flows will be driven by a number of factors, macroeconomic and otherwise, Brexit ORG and the end of free movement will result in a large fall in immigration from EEA ORG countries to the UK."[206] According to a 2016 DATE study by Portes ORG , "The spectrum of options for UK GPE immigration policy post Brexit GPE remains wide... However, almost any plausible outcome will result in an increase in regulatory burdens on business; a reduction in the flows of both unskilled and skilled workers; and an increase in illegal working. The key question for policymakers will be how to minimise these negative impacts while at the same time addressing domestic political demands for increased control without antagonising our EU ORG partners to the point of prejudicing other key aspects of the negotiations. This will not be an easy task."[22 WORK_OF_ART ] Will Somerville GPE of the Migration Policy Institute ORG wrote that "Future migration levels are impossible to predict in the absence of policy and economic certainty", but estimated immediately after the referendum that the UK GPE "would continue to receive 500,000 CARDINAL or more immigrants (from EU ORG and non- EU ORG countries taken together) per year, with annual DATE net migration around 200,000".[207]
The decline in EEA ORG immigration is likely to have an adverse impact on the British NORP health sector.[208] According to the New York Times ORG , Brexit ORG "seems certain" to make it harder and costlier for the NHS ORG , which already suffers from chronic understaffing, to recruit nurses, midwives and doctors from the rest of Europe.[208 PERSON ]
Immediate effects
Official figures in March 2017 DATE indicated that EU ORG immigration to the UK GPE continued to exceed emigration, but the difference between immigration and emigration ("net migration") had fallen to its lowest for three CARDINAL years.[209] The number of EU ORG nurses registering with the NHS ORG fell from 1,304 CARDINAL in July 2016 DATE to 46 CARDINAL in April DATE 2017.[210 PRODUCT ]
British NORP citizens' attempts to retain EU ORG citizenship PERSON Since the referendum, British NORP citizens have attempted to ensure their retention of EU ORG citizenship via a number of different mechanisms, including applying to other EU ORG countries for citizenship,[211][212] and petitioning the European Commission.[213 ORG ]
Economic effects
Main article: Economic effects of Brexit
Immediate effects
One study estimated that the referendum result had pushed up UK GPE inflation by 1.7 CARDINAL percentage points in the subsequent year DATE , leading to an annual DATE cost of 404 MONEY for the average British NORP household.[20] Another study estimated that by September 2018 DATE , the economic costs of the Brexit FAC vote were 2% PERCENT of GDP.[18][214][215] A September 2018 DATE analysis by the think tank Centre for European Reform ORG estimated that the losses amounted to 2.5% PERCENT of GDP.[216] Another analysis found, using the synthetic control method, that the Brexit ORG referendum caused a decline in trade in the subsequent two CARDINAL years.[217][218]
According to a Financial Times ORG analysis, the Brexit GPE referendum results had by December 2017 DATE reduced national British NORP income by between 0.6% and 1.3% PERCENT , which amounts to almost 350million MONEY a week.[219] University of California, Berkeley ORG , economist Barry Eichengreen PERSON said in August 2017 DATE that some of the adverse effects of uncertainty brought about by the Brexit GPE referendum were being made apparent, as British NORP consumer confidence was down and spending had declined to its lowest level in four CARDINAL years.[220] In November 2017 DATE , it was reported that European NORP banks had reduced their UK GPE -related assets by 350bn in the 12 months DATE after Brexit ORG vote,and that the trend was expected to increase ahead of the March 2019 DATE Brexit GPE deadline.[221]
A 2018 DATE analysis by economists at Stanford University ORG and Nottingham University ORG estimated that uncertainty around Brexit GPE reduced investment by businesses by approximately 6 CARDINAL percentage points and an employment reduction by 1.5 CARDINAL percentage points.[19] A 2019 DATE analysis by University of Cambridge ORG economists and a 2018 DATE analysis by University of Maryland and University of Michigan ORG economists found that uncertainty about the United Kingdom's GPE future trade policy which resulted from the Brexit GPE referendum result depressed the United Kingdom's GPE international trading activity from June 2016 DATE onwards.[222][223][21] A 2019 DATE analysis found that British NORP firms substantially increased offshoring to the European Union ORG after the Brexit GPE referendum, whereas European NORP firms reduced new investments in the UK.[224][225]
Long-term economic analyses
There is overwhelming or near-unanimous agreement among economists that leaving the European Union ORG will adversely affect the British NORP economy in the medium- and long-term.[lower-alpha 1][237 CARDINAL ] Surveys of economists in 2016 DATE showed overwhelming agreement that Brexit ORG would likely reduce the UK GPE 's real per-capita income level.[227][228][229] A 2019 DATE survey of 12 CARDINAL economic simulation models of Brexit GPE by the Peterson Institute for International Economics ORG found that the credible estimates for a Hard Brexit ORG ranged between GDP losses of -1,2 and -4,5 for the UK GPE whereas the GDP losses would be approximately halved by a Soft Brexit.[237] A 2017 DATE survey of the existing academic literature found "the research literature displays a broad consensus that in the long run Brexit ORG will make the United Kingdom GPE poorer because it will create new barriers to trade, foreign direct investment, and immigration. However, there is substantial uncertainty over how large the effect will be, with plausible estimates of the cost ranging between 1 and 10 per cent CARDINAL of the UK GPE 's income per capita."[16] These estimates differ depending on whether the UK GPE stays in the European Single Market ORG (for instance, by joining the EEA ORG ), makes a free trade agreement with the EU ORG , or reverts to the trade rules that govern relations between all World Trade Organization ORG members.[16] In January 2018 DATE , the UK GPE government's own Brexit FAC analysis was leaked; it showed that UK GPE economic growth would be stunted by 28% PERCENT for at least 15 years DATE following secession from the EU ORG , depending on the leave scenario.[238][239]
Most economists, including the UK Treasury ORG , argue that being in the EU ORG has a strong positive effect on trade and as a result the UK GPE 's trade would be worse off if it left the EU.[240][241][242][243 PERSON ] According to a group of University of Cambridge ORG economists, under a "hard Brexit ORG " whereby the UK GPE reverts to WTO ORG rules, one-third CARDINAL of UK GPE exports to the EU ORG would be tariff-free, one-quarter DATE would face high trade barriers and other exports risk tariffs in the range of 110%.[244 CARDINAL ] A 2017 DATE study based on data from 2010 DATE found that "almost all UK GPE regions are systematically more vulnerable to Brexit GPE than regions in any other country. Due to their longstanding trade integration with the UK GPE , Irish NORP regions have levels of Brexit GPE exposure, which are similar to those of the UK GPE regions with the lowest levels of exposure, namely London GPE and northern parts of Scotland GPE . Meanwhile, the other most risk-exposed EU ORG regions are all in southern Germany GPE , with levels of risk which are typically half CARDINAL that of any UK GPE or Irish NORP region, and one third CARDINAL of that displayed by many UK GPE regions. There is also a very noticeable economic geography logic to the levels of exposure with north-western European NORP regions typically being the most exposed to Brexit GPE , while regions in southern and eastern Europe LOC are barely affected at all by Brexit ORG , at least in terms of the trade linkages... Overall, the UK GPE is far more exposed to Brexit GPE risks than the rest of the EU."[245]
After the referendum, the Institute for Fiscal Studies ORG published a report funded by the Economic and Social Research Council ORG which warned that Britain GPE would lose up to 70billion MONEY in reduced economic growth if it did not retain Single Market ORG membership, with new trade deals unable to make up the difference.[246] One CARDINAL of these areas is financial services, which are helped by EU ORG -wide "passporting" for financial products, which an Oliver Wyman PERSON report for a pro- EU ORG lobby group estimated indirectly accounted for up to 71,000 CARDINAL jobs and 10billion MONEY of tax annually,[247][not in citation given] and some banks announced plans to relocate some of their operations outside the UK.[248] According to a 2016 DATE article by John Armour PERSON , Professor of Law PERSON and Finance at Oxford University ORG , "a 'soft' Brexit FAC , whereby the UK GPE leaves the EU ORG but remains in the single market, would be a lower-risk option for the City than other Brexit GPE options, because it would enable financial services firms to continue to rely on regulatory passporting rights."[249]
A 2017 DATE study found, on the basis of "plausible, empirically based estimates of the likely impacts on growth and wages using relationships from the existing empirical literature", that " Brexit GPE -induced reductions in migration are likely to have a significant negative impact on UK GPE GDPper capita (and GDP), with marginal positive impacts on wages in the low-skill service sector."[250][16] It is unclear how changes in trade and foreign investment will interact with immigration, but these changes are likely to be important.[16]
Former Governor of the Bank of England ORG Mervyn King PERSON commented that warnings of economic doom regarding leaving the EU ORG were overstated and that the UK GPE should leave the single market and probably the customs union in order to gain more opportunities, which would lead to improved British NORP economic performance.[251]
Short-term economic analyses
Short-term macroeconomic forecasts by the Bank of England ORG and other banks of what would happen immediately after the Brexit GPE referendum proved to be too pessimistic.[231][252] The assessments assumed that the referendum results would create greater uncertainty on financial markets and in business and reduce consumer confidence more than it did.[252] According to Oxford University ORG economist Simon Wren-Lewis PERSON , "short term unconditional macroeconomic forecasts are extremely unreliable" and they are something that academic economists do not do, unlike banks.[253] Wren-Lewis PERSON notes that long-term projections of the impact of Brexit GPE , on the other hand, have a strong empirical foundation.[253] University of California, Berkeley ORG , economist Barry Eichengreen PERSON wrote that economists "have had little success at reliably predicting when and why uncertainty arises"and that it is unclear how severe the impact of uncertainty actually is.[220]
King's ORG College London economist Jonathan Portes PERSON said that "short-term economic forecasting is very unreliable". He compared short-term economic forecasts to weather forecasts and the long-term economic forecasts to climate forecasts: the methodologies used in long-term forecasts are "well-established and robust".[252] Other economists note that central bank forecasts are not intended for pinpoint accuracy.[252] London School of Economics ORG economist Thomas Sampson PERSON notes that it is harder to assess the short-term impact that the transition process to Brexit ORG will have, but that long-term assessments of the post-Brexit period are more reliable.[16] According to the Financial Times ORG , economists are in agreement that the short-term effects are uncertain.[231]
On 5 January 2017 DATE , Andy Haldane PERSON , the Chief Economist ORG and the Executive ORG Director of Monetary Analysis ORG and Statistics at the Bank of England ORG , said that the BoE GPE 's own forecast predicting an immediate economic downturn due to the referendum result was inaccurate and said there was strong market performance immediately after the referendum,[254][255][256 LOC ] although some have pointed to prices rising faster than wages.[257] Haldane ORG said that the field of economics was "to some degree in crisis" because of its failure to predict the financial crisis of 20072008 CARDINAL , and added that the Brexit GPE economic forecast was only inaccurate in its near-term assessment, and that over time, the Bank ORG still expected that Brexit ORG would harm economic growth.[255] Imperial College ORG London economist David Miles PERSON responded to Haldane ORG , saying that there was no crisis in economics, and that economists did not purport to be able to forecast with full certainty or predict the precise timing of events.[258] Miles PERSON said that it was widely acknowledged among economists that short-term forecasts, such as the BoE GPE 's, are unreliable.[258] Inequality Studies WORK_OF_ART on the economic impact that different forms of Brexit FAC will have on different parts of the country undertaken in 2016 DATE and 2018 DATE indicated that Brexit ORG will exacerbate regional economic inequality in the UK GPE , as already struggling regions will be hardest hit by Brexit.[259]
Financial sector
According to economist Barry Eichengreen PERSON of the University of California, Berkeley ORG , London GPE s future as an international financial centre depends on whether the UK GPE will obtain passporting rights for British NORP banks from the European Union ORG . If banks located in the UK GPE cannot obtain passporting rights, they have strong incentives to relocate to financial centres within the EU.[260] Relocation ORG of agencies Brexit FAC requires relocating the offices and staff of the European Medicines Agency ORG and European Banking Authority ORG , currently based in London.[261] The agencies together employ more than 1,000 CARDINAL people and will respectively relocate to Amsterdam GPE and Paris.[262] The EU ORG is also considering restricting the clearing of euro-denominated trades to eurozone jurisdictions, which would end London GPE 's dominance in this sector.[263]
"No-deal" plan to remove tariffs
In March 2019 DATE , the UK GPE government announced that it would cut many import tariffs to zero CARDINAL , in the event of a no-deal Brexit.[264 GPE ] The Confederation of British Industry ORG said the move would be a "sledgehammer for our economy",[265][266][267] and the National Farmer's Union ORG was also highly critical.[268] Additionally, the plan appears to breach standard WTO ORG rules.[269][265][270][271][272][273][274][275][276]
Energy
According to a 2017 DATE study by University of Exeter and ORG Chatham House ORG researchers, there are considerable benefits for the UK GPE to be integrated into the European NORP energy market. The study notes, "if the UK GPE wants to enjoy the economic benefits of remaining part of what is an increasingly integrated European NORP electricity market then, as European NORP legislation is currently drafted, it will not only have to forgo an element of autonomy through accepting legislation and regulations made collectively at the EU GPE level, but it will also lose much of its voice in that decision making process, effectively becoming a rule-taker rather than a rule-maker."[277] Fishing PRODUCT The combined EU ORG fishing fleets land about 6 million tonnes QUANTITY of fish per year,[278] of which about 3 million tonnes QUANTITY are from UK GPE waters.[279] The UK GPE 's share of the overall EU ORG fishing catch is only 750,000 tonnes QUANTITY ( 830,000 CARDINAL tons).[280] This proportion is determined by the London Fisheries Convention LAW of 1964 DATE and by the EU ORG 's Common Fisheries Policy. The UK GPE government announced in July 2017 DATE that it would end the 1964 DATE convention in 2019 DATE . Loss of access to UK GPE waters will particularly affect the Irish NORP fishing industry which obtains a third ORDINAL of its catch there.[281]
According to an analysis by researchers at Wageningen University and Research ORG , Brexit ORG would lead to higher prices in seafood for consumers (because the UK GPE imports most of its seafood). British NORP fishermen would be able to catch more fish, but the price for UK GPE fish would decline. As a result, the analysis found that Brexit GPE would result in a "lose-lose situation" for both the UK GPE and the EU GPE , and for both British NORP consumers and the fishing industry.[282] According to a 2018 DATE study, " Brexit GPE poses a major challenge to the stability of European NORP fisheries management. Until now, neighbouring EU GPE Member States GPE have shared the bounty of the living resources of the seas around Britain GPE . Taking full responsibility for the regulation of fisheries within the UK GPE 's Exclusive Economic Zone LOC will cut across longstanding relationships, potentially putting at risk recent recovery and future sustainability of shared fish stocks."[283] Health ORG A 2019 DATE study in the Lancet ORG suggested that Brexit ORG would have an adverse impact on health in the UK GPE under every Brexit GPE scenario, but that a No-Deal Brexit would have the worst impact.[284] The study found that Brexit ORG would deplete the National Health Service ( ORG NHS ORG ) workforce, create uncertainties regarding care for British NORP nationals living in the EU ORG , and put at risk access to vaccines, equipment, and medicines.[284]
Higher education and academic research Main ORG article: Brexit FAC and arrangements for science and technology
According to a 2016 DATE study by Ken Mayhew PERSON , Emeritus Professor of Education ORG and Economic Performance at Oxford University ORG , Brexit GPE poses the following threats to higher education: "loss of research funding from EU ORG sources; loss of students from other EU ORG countries; the impact on the ability of the sector to hire academic staff from EU ORG countries; and the impact on the ability of UK GPE students to study abroad."[23]
The UK GPE received more from the EU ORG for research than it contributed[285][286] with universities getting just over 10% PERCENT of their research income from the EU.[287] All funding for net beneficiaries from the EU ORG , including universities, was guaranteed by the government in August DATE 2016.[288 FAC ] Before the funding announcement, a newspaper investigation reported that some research projects were reluctant to include British NORP researchers due to uncertainties over funding.[289] Currently the UK GPE is part of the European Research Area ORG and the UK GPE is likely to wish to remain an associated member.[290] Sports ORG and culture
Brexit FAC will have an effect on sports and culture. Before Brexit GPE , people from EU ORG / EEA ORG countries need minimal bureaucracy to play or perform in the UK GPE . After Brexit FAC , any foreigner wanting to do so more than temporarily will need a work permit. At present, before Brexit GPE , such work permits for non- EU ORG team players can be tricky to get, especially for young or lower ranked players.[291][292 PERSON ]
Scotland
First Minister of Scotland Nicola Sturgeon ORG addresses journalists over Brexit GPE and Scotland GPE 's place within Europe LOC at Bute House FAC .
As suggested by the Scottish Government ORG before the referendum,[293] the First ORDINAL Minister of Scotland GPE announced that officials were planning an independence referendum due to the result of Scotland GPE voting to remain in the European Union ORG when England GPE and Wales GPE voted to leave.[294] In March 2017 DATE , the SNP ORG leader and First ORDINAL Minister Nicola Sturgeon PERSON requested a second ORDINAL Scottish NORP independence referendum in 2018 DATE or 2019 DATE (before Britain GPE 's formal exit from the EU).[295 PERSON ] The UK GPE Prime Minister immediately rejected the requested timing, but not the referendum itself.[296] The referendum was approved by the Scottish Parliament ORG on 28 March 2017 DATE . Sturgeon called for a "phased return" of an independent Scotland GPE back to the EU.[297]
After the referendum, First ORDINAL Minister Sturgeon PERSON suggested that Scotland GPE might refuse consent for legislation required to leave the EU,[298] though some lawyers argue that Scotland GPE cannot block Brexit.[299]
On 21 March 2018 DATE , the Scottish Parliament ORG passed the Scottish Continuity ORG Bill.[300] This was passed due to stalling negotiations between the Scottish Government ORG and the British Government ORG on where powers within devolved policy areas should lie after exit day DATE from the European Union ORG . This Act allows for all devolved policy areas to remain within the remit of the Scottish Parliament ORG and reduces the executive power upon exit day that the UK GPE Withdrawal Bill PERSON provides for Ministers of the Crown.[301] The Bill PERSON gained Royal Assent ORG on 28 April DATE 2018.[300] Transport Aviation The United Kingdom Government ORG issued a guidance document on aviation in September 2018.[302 DATE ] The nature of the United Kingdom's GPE aviation agreements can be divided into three CARDINAL main categories: European Union ORG - 27 CARDINAL EU ORG countries that are part of the European Common Aviation Area ORG ( ECAA ORG )
ECAA ORG partnerships with non- EU GPE countries - 17 CARDINAL non- EU ORG countries with agreements such as Eurocontrol ORG and EU ORG US Open Skies Agreement EVENT Air Service Agreements ( ASA ORG ) - bilateral agreements between the United Kingdom GPE and 111 CARDINAL countries
Flights between the UK GPE and EU GPE are enshrined into the European Common Aviation Area ORG . The UK Government's ORG aviation guidance document states that post-Brexit CARDINAL :
" UK GPE and EU ORG licensed airlines would lose the automatic right to operate air services between the UK GPE and the EU GPE without seeking advance permission. This would mean that airlines operating between the UK GPE and the EU ORG would need to seek individual permissions to operate".[302] In the event that no agreement can be made between the UK GPE and EU GPE , it is the intention of the UK Government ORG to allow permission for existing flights to the UK GPE to remain unimpeded in the expectation this will be reciprocated by EU ORG countries.[302] The loss of automatic access to the European Common Aviation Area ORG will affect airlines; for instance a British NORP registered airline cannot operate intra- EU ORG flights, nor can a European NORP registered airline operate domestic UK GPE flights. Some British NORP airlines have created European NORP divisions to resolve the issue such as Easyjet ORG which formed easyJet Europe LOC in July 2017 DATE .
The UK GPE has sought to replace the existing partnerships the EU ORG has with the 17 CARDINAL non- EU ORG countries. By the end of 2018 DATE , the UK GPE had concluded individual air service agreements ( ASA ORG ) with the United ORG States,[303] Canada[303 ORG ] Switzerland,[304] Albania GPE , Georgia GPE , Iceland GPE , Israel GPE , Kosovo GPE , Montenegro GPE and Morocco GPE .
