Such agreements supersede EU ORG agreements made on behalf of the United Kingdom GPE (by virtue of its EU ORG membership) and mean flights to and from these countries will continue as scheduled post-Brexit.[302]
Lastly, most countries have separate bilateral air service agreements ( ASA ORG ) with the United Kingdom GPE which permit flights to and from the country. The UK GPE has such agreements with 111 CARDINAL countries around the world, including Brazil GPE , China GPE and India GPE . These bilateral agreements are independent of the EU ORG and are not dependent on the UK GPE 's membership of the EU ORG . As stated in guidance document on aviation issued by the United Kingdom Government ORG in September 2018 DATE , "for airlines from one CARDINAL of the 111 CARDINAL countries with whom the UK GPE has a bilateral ASA ORG , including China GPE , India GPE and Brazil GPE , there will be no change [post Brexit]."[302 GPE ]
The European Aviation Safety Agency ORG will no longer cover UK GPE airlines.[305]
Rail
The French NORP minister for European Affairs ORG , Nathalie Loiseau PERSON , said in September 2018 DATE that trains in the Channel Tunnel LOC may no longer be allowed into France GPE in the event of a no-deal Brexit.[306] Discussions were carried out in October DATE between the British Department for Transport ORG and the rail transport authorities of France GPE , Belgium GPE and the Netherlands.[307 ORG ] A temporary authorisation for three months DATE was eventually agreed in February 2019 DATE , in order to ensure transport continuity in the event of a no-deal Brexit.[308 ORG ] Road FAC traffic
The Vienna Convention on Road Traffic is written by the UN ORG , not the EU ORG , allowing road traffic between the UK GPE and EU GPE even without a deal.
The UK GPE will remain in the European Common Transit Convention ORG (CTC) after Brexit.[309] This would apply to any new trading relationship with the EU ORG , including after exit with no Withdrawal Agreement LAW treaty.[310] The CTC ORG applies to moving goods between the EU ORG member states, the EFTA ORG countries ( Iceland GPE , Norway GPE , Liechtenstein GPE and Switzerland GPE ) as well as Turkey GPE , Macedonia GPE and Serbia GPE . The CTC ORG , with its supplementary Convention on the Simplification of Formalities LAW in the Trade of Goods ORG , reduces administrative burdens on traders by removing the need for additional import/export declarations when transiting customs territories, and provides cashflow benefits by allowing the movement of goods across a customs territory without the payment of duties until the final destination.[311]
In the event of a "no-deal" Brexit GPE , the number of permits available to haulage drivers will be "severely limited": the Department for Transport ORG proposes to allocate these by lottery.[312] Even with a customs union, the experience of Turkish NORP hauliers suggests that significant difficulties and delays will occur both at the border and within some countries.[313]
Shipping
Ferries will continue, but with obstacles such as customs checks.[314] New ferry departures between Ireland GPE and the continent will emerge.[314]
Impact of Brexit on bilateral UK GPE relations International ORG agreements
The Financial Times ORG said that there were approximately 759 CARDINAL international agreements, spanning 168 CARDINAL non- EU ORG countries, that the UK GPE would no longer be a party to upon leaving the EU.[315] This figure does not include World Trade Organization ORG or United Nations ORG opt-in accords, and excludes "narrow agreements", which may also have to be renegotiated.[315]
Security
Concerns have been raised that Brexit ORG might create security problems for the UK GPE . In particular in law enforcement and counterterrorism where the UK GPE could use the European Union's ORG databases on individuals crossing the British NORP border. Security experts have credited the EU ORG 's information-sharing databases with helping to foil terrorist plots. British NORP leaders have expressed support for retaining access to those information-sharing databases, but it could be complicated to obtain that access as a non-member of the EU ORG . Brexit ORG would also complicate extradition requests. Under a hard Brexit FAC scenario, the UK GPE would lose access to basic law enforcement tools, such as databases comprising European NORP plane travel records, vehicle registrations, fingerprints and DNA profiles.[316]
In December 2018 DATE , Conservative MEPs approved a new plan to fight terrorism that calls for the EU ORG to have a close security partnership with the UK GPE post-Brexit.[317] Options ORG for continuing relationship with the EU Main ORG article: Continuing UK GPE relationship with the EU
The UK GPE 's post- Brexit GPE relationship with the remaining EU ORG members could take several forms. A research paper presented to the UK Parliament ORG in July 2013 DATE proposed a number of alternatives to membership which would continue to allow access to the EU ORG internal market. These include remaining in the European Economic LOC Area,[318] negotiating deep bilateral agreements on the Swiss NORP model,[318] or exit from the EU ORG without EEA ORG membership or a trade agreement under the WTO Option ORG . There may be an interim deal between the time the UK GPE leaves the EU GPE and when the final relationship comes in force.
Border with the Republic of Ireland GPE
Further information: Irish NORP border question
The UK/Republic of Ireland GPE border crosses this road at Killeen GPE (near Newry GPE ), marked only by a speed limit in km/h. ( Northern Ireland GPE uses mph.)
There is concern about whether the border between the Republic of Ireland GPE and Northern Ireland GPE becomes a "hard border" with customs and passport checks on the border,[319] and whether this could affect the Good Friday Agreement EVENT that brought peace to Northern Ireland.[320][321][322] In order to forestall this the European Union ORG proposed a "backstop agreement" within the Withdrawal Agreement LAW that would put Northern Ireland GPE under a range of EU ORG rules in order to forestall the need for border checks. Although the UK GPE government has signed off on proposals including the backstop, it regards the idea of having EU ORG rules applying in Northern Ireland GPE only as a threat to the integrity of the UK GPE , and also does not want the UK GPE as a whole to be subject to EU ORG rules and the customs union indefinitely.[323] In late October 2018 DATE , the National Audit Office ORG warned that it was already too late to prepare the necessary Irish NORP border security checks in the event of a no-deal Brexit GPE a weakness that organised crime would be quick to exploit.[324]
Until March 2019 DATE , both the UK GPE and Ireland GPE will be members of the EU ORG , and therefore both are in the Customs Union ORG and the Single Market ORG . There is freedom of movement for all EU ORG nationals within the Common Travel Area ORG and there are no customs or fixed immigration controls at the border. Since 2005 DATE , the border has been essentially invisible.[325] Following Brexit GPE , the border between Northern Ireland GPE and the Republic of Ireland GPE will become a land border between the EU ORG and a non- EU GPE state which may entail checks on goods at the border, depending on the co-operation and alignment of regulations between the two CARDINAL sides. It is therefore possible that the border will return to being a "hard" one, with fewer, controlled, crossing posts and a customs infrastructure. Both the EU ORG and the UK GPE have agreed this should be avoided.[326] Research published on 18 February 2019 DATE by Irish NORP Senator Mark Daly PERSON and two CARDINAL UNESCO ORG chairmen indicated that reinstating a hard border would result in the return of violence.[327][328][329][330]
In March 2019 DATE , the UK GPE government announced that it would not perform customs checks at the Irish NORP border after a no-deal Brexit GPE and acknowledged that that might present a smuggling risk.[264][269][265][270][331][332][271 ORG ] On 17 March DATE the President of Ireland GPE signed into law the Withdrawal of the United Kingdom GPE from the European Union GPE ( Consequential Provisions) Act LAW 2019.[333] Border GPE with France GPE
The President of the Regional Council of Hauts-de-France ORG , Xavier Bertrand PERSON , stated in February 2016 DATE that "If Britain GPE leaves Europe LOC , right away the border will leave Calais ORG and go to Dover GPE . We will not continue to guard the border for Britain GPE if it's no longer in the European Union ORG ," indicating that the juxtaposed controls would end with a leave vote. French NORP Finance Minister Emmanuel Macron PERSON also suggested the agreement would be "threatened" by a leave vote.[334] These claims have been disputed, as the Le FAC Touquet 2003 DATE treaty enabling juxtaposed controls was not an EU ORG treaty, and would not be legally void upon leaving.[335 ORG ]
After the Brexit ORG vote, Xavier Bertrand PERSON asked Franois Hollande PERSON to renegotiate the Touquet agreement,[336 ORG ] which can be terminated by either party with two years' DATE notice.[337] Hollande PERSON rejected the suggestion, and said: "Calling into question the Touquet deal on the pretext that Britain GPE has voted for Brexit ORG and will have to start negotiations to leave the Union ORG doesn't make sense." Bernard Cazeneuve PERSON , the French NORP Interior Minister, confirmed there would be "no changes to the accord". He said: "The border at Calais ORG is closed and will remain so."[338 ORG ]
Gibraltar and Spain GPE Main ORG article: Effect of Brexit FAC on Gibraltar
Cars crossing into Gibraltar GPE clearing customs formalities. Gibraltar GPE is outside the customs union, VAT area LOC and Schengen Zone GPE .
Gibraltar GPE is outside the European Union's ORG common customs area and common commercial policy and so has a customs border with Spain GPE . Nevertheless, the territory remains within the European Union ORG until Brexit GPE is complete.
During the campaign leading up to the referendum[339] the Chief Minister of Gibraltar ORG warned that Brexit GPE posed a threat to Gibraltar GPE 's safety.[340] Gibraltar GPE voted overwhelmingly ( 96 per cent MONEY ) to remain in the EU ORG . After the result Spain GPE 's Foreign Minister renewed calls for joint Spanish LANGUAGE British NORP control of the peninsula.[341] These calls were strongly rebuffed by Gibraltar GPE 's Chief Minister[342] and questions were raised over the future of free-flowing traffic at the Gibraltar GPE Spain GPE border.[343] The UK GPE government states it will only negotiate on the sovereignty of Gibraltar GPE with the consent of its people.[344]
In February 2018 DATE , Sir Joe Bossano PERSON , Gibraltar GPE 's Minister for Enterprise, Training, Employment and Health and Safety ORG (and former Chief Minister) expressed frustration at the EU ORG 's attitude, suggesting that Spain GPE was being offered a veto, adding "It's enough to convert me from a supporter of the European Union ORG into a Brexiteer".[345 GPE ]
In April 2018 DATE , Spanish NORP Foreign Minister Alfonso Dastis PERSON announced that Spain GPE hopes to sign off on a bilateral agreement with Britain GPE over Gibraltar GPE before October DATE so as not to hinder a Brexit GPE transition deal. Talks between London GPE and Madrid GPE had progressed well. While reiterating the Spanish NORP long-term aim of "recovering" Gibraltar GPE , he said that Spain GPE would not hold Gibraltar GPE as a "hostage" to the EU GPE negotiations.[346] The predecessor of Dastis ORG , Jos Manuel Garca-Margallo PERSON (who had been very combative in the Gibraltar GPE dispute during his ministerial spell) had asked Dastis ORG during the later's inauguration to not waste the chance to advance in the Spanish NORP claim for the territory.[347] After the successful 2018 DATE vote of no confidence in the government of Mariano Rajoy PERSON and Josep Borrell PERSON becoming the new Foreign minister, the later assured the diplomatic stance of Spain GPE remained the same as with Dastis ORG , "with the same negotiating team and the same approach".[348 ORG ] Relations ORG with CANZUK ORG countries See ORG also: CANZUK International Pro-Brexit ORG activists and politicians have argued that for negotiating trade and migration agreements with the " CANZUK ORG " countriesthose of Canada GPE , Australia GPE , New Zealand GPE and the United Kingdom.[349][350] Numerous academics have criticised this alternative for EU ORG membership as "post-imperial nostalgia".[351][352][353] Economists note that distance reduces trade, a key aspect of the gravity model of trade, which means that even if the UK GPE could obtain similar trade terms with the CANZUK ORG countries as it had as part of the Single Market ORG , it would be far less valuable to the UK.[354][355][356] Political ORG impacts of withdrawal for the EU Main ORG article: Impact of Brexit ORG on the European Union Structure ORG and budget
Shortly after the referendum, the German NORP parliament published an analysis on the consequences of a Brexit FAC on the EU ORG and specifically on the economic and political situation of Germany.[357 PERSON ] According to this, Britain GPE is, after the United States GPE and France GPE , the third ORDINAL -most important export market for German NORP products. In total Germany GPE exports goods and services to Britain GPE worth about 120billion MONEY annually DATE , which is about 8% PERCENT of German NORP exports, with Germany GPE achieving a trade surplus with Britain GPE worth 36.3billion MONEY ( 2014 DATE ). Should there be a "hard Brexit ORG ", exports would be subject to WTO ORG customs and tariffs. The trade weighted average tariff is 2.4% PERCENT , but the tariff on automobiles, for instance, is 9.7% PERCENT , so trade in automobiles would be particularly affected; this would also affect German NORP automobile manufacturers with production plants in the United Kingdom GPE . In total, 750,000 CARDINAL jobs in Germany GPE depend upon export to Britain GPE , while on the British NORP side about three million CARDINAL jobs depend on export to the EU ORG . The study emphasises however that the predictions on the economic effects of a Brexit GPE are subject to significant uncertainty.
With Brexit, the EU ORG would lose its second ORDINAL -largest economy, the country with the third ORDINAL -largest population and "the financial capital of the world", as the German NORP newspaper Mnchner Merkur PERSON put it.[358] Furthermore, the EU ORG would lose its second ORDINAL -largest net contributor to the EU ORG budget ( 2015 DATE : Germany GPE 14.3billion MONEY , United Kingdom GPE 11.5billion MONEY , France GPE 5.5 CARDINAL billion).[359]
Thus, the departure of Britain GPE would result in an additional financial burden for the remaining net contributors, unless the budget is reduced accordingly: Germany GPE , for example, would have to pay an additional 4.5 billion MONEY for 2019 DATE and again for 2020 DATE ; in addition, the UK GPE would no longer be a shareholder in the European Investment Bank ORG , in which only EU ORG members can participate. Britain GPE 's share amounts to 16% PERCENT , 39.2billion MONEY ( 2013 DATE ), which Britain GPE would withdraw unless there is an EU GPE treaty change.[360] Council of the European Union Analyses ORG indicate that the departure of the relatively economically liberal UK GPE will reduce the ability of remaining economically liberal countries to block measures in the Council of the European Union.[361][362 ORG ] According to the Lisbon Treaty LAW ( 2009 DATE ), decisions of the Council ORG are made by qualified majority voting, which means that a majority view can be blocked should at least four CARDINAL members of the Council ORG , representing at least 35% PERCENT of the population of the Union, choose to do so. In many policy votes, Britain GPE , allied with other northern EU ORG allies ( Germany GPE , Ireland GPE , the Netherlands GPE , the Scandinavian NORP and the Baltic NORP states), had a blocking minority of 35% PERCENT . The exit of the UK GPE from the European Union ORG means that this blocking minority can no longer be assembled without support from other countries, leading to speculation that it could enable the more protectionist EU ORG countries to achieve specific proposals such as relaxing EU ORG budget discipline or providing EU ORG -wide deposit guarantees within the banking union.[363][364] European Parliament ORG
UK GPE MEPs are expected to retain full rights to participate in the European Parliament ORG up to the Article 50 CARDINAL deadline. However, there have been discussions about excluding UK GPE MEPs from key committee positions.[365]
The EU ORG will need to decide on the revised apportionment of seats in the European Parliament ORG in time for the next European Parliament ORG election to be held in May 2019 DATE (with the parliamentary term starting in June DATE ), when the United Kingdom's GPE 73 CARDINAL MEPs will have vacated their seats. In April 2017 DATE , a group of European NORP lawmakers discussed what should be done about the vacated seats. One CARDINAL plan, supported by Gianni Pittella PERSON and Emmanuel Macron PERSON , is to replace the 73 CARDINAL seats with a pan- European NORP constituency list; other options which were considered include dropping the British NORP seats without replacement, and reassigning some or all of the existing seats from other countries to reduce inequality of representation.[366][367]
Legal system
The UK GPE 's exit from the European Union ORG will leave Ireland GPE and Cyprus GPE as the only two CARDINAL remaining common law jurisdictions in the EU ORG . Paul Gallagher PERSON , a former Attorney General of Ireland GPE , has suggested this will isolate those countries and deprive them of a powerful partner that shared a common interest in ensuring that EU GPE legislation was not drafted or interpreted in a way that would be contrary to the principles of the common law.[368] Lucinda Creighton PERSON , a former Irish NORP government minister for legal affairs, has said that Ireland GPE relies on the "bureaucratic capacity of the UK GPE " to understand, influence and implement EU ORG legislation.[369] World Trade Organization ORG
Questions have arisen over how existing international arrangements with the EU ORG under World Trade Organization ORG ( WTO ORG ) terms should evolve. Some countries such as Australia GPE and the United States GPE wish to challenge the basis for division (i.e., division between the UK GPE and the continuing EU ORG ) of the trade schedules previously agreed between them and the EU GPE , because it reduces their flexibility.[370 FAC ] Public ORG opinion and comment Public ORG comment up to February 2017 DATE UK GPE white paper
Various EU leaders said that they would not start any negotiation before the UK GPE formally invokes Article 50 LAW . Jean-Claude Juncker PERSON ordered all members of the EU Commission ORG not to engage in any kind of contact with UK GPE parties regarding Brexit.[371 EVENT ] In October 2016 DATE , he stated that he was agitated that the British NORP had not developed a sense of community with Europeans NORP during 40 years DATE of membership; Juncker PERSON denied that Brexit ORG was a warning for the EU ORG , envisaged developing an EU ORG defence policy without the British NORP after Brexit ORG , and rejected a suggestion that the EU ORG should negotiate in such a way that Britain GPE would be able to hold a second ORDINAL referendum.[372] On 5 November 2016 DATE , Juncker ORG reacted to reports of some European NORP businesses seeking to make agreements with the UK GPE government, and warned: "I am telling them [companies] that they should not interfere in the debate, as they will find that I will block their path."[373] Juncker ORG stated in February 2017 DATE that the UK GPE would be expected to pay outstanding commitments to EU ORG projects and pensions as part of the withdrawal process, suggesting such bills would be "very hefty."[374]
German NORP foreign secretary Frank-Walter Steinmeier PERSON met Britain GPE 's foreign secretary Boris Johnson PERSON on 4 November 2016 DATE ; Johnson PERSON stressed the importance of British-German NORP relationships, whereas Steinmeier PERSON responded that the German NORP view was that the UK GPE should have voted to stay in the EU ORG and that the German NORP priority now was to preserve the remaining union of 27 CARDINAL members. There could be no negotiations before the UK GPE formally gives notice. A long delay before beginning negotiations would be detrimental. Britain GPE could not keep the advantages of the single market but at the same time cancel the "less pleasant rules".[375]
Newly appointed prime minister Theresa May PERSON made clear that negotiations with the EU ORG required a " UK GPE -wide approach". On 15 July 2016 DATE , she said: "I have already said that I won't be triggering article 50 until I think that we have a UK GPE approach and objectives for negotiations I think it is important that we establish that before we trigger article 50."[376]
According to The Daily Telegraph ORG , the Department for Exiting the European Union ORG spent over 250,000 MONEY on legal advice from top Government lawyers in two months DATE , and had plans to recruit more people. Nick Clegg PERSON said the figures showed the Civil Service ORG was unprepared for the very complex negotiations ahead.[377]
In the wake of the United Kingdom's GPE vote to leave the European Union ORG , the Department for International Trade ORG ( DIT ORG ) for striking and extending trade agreements between the UK GPE and non- EU ORG states was created by Prime Minister Theresa May PERSON , shortly after she took office on 13 July 2016.[378 DATE ] It employs about 200 CARDINAL trade negotiators[379] and is overseen by the Secretary of State for International Trade ORG , currently Liam Fox PERSON .
On 17 January 2017 DATE , Prime Minister Theresa May PERSON announced a series of 12 CARDINAL negotiating objectives in a speech at Lancaster House ORG . These consist of an end to European Court of Justice ORG jurisdiction, withdrawal from the single market with a "comprehensive free-trade agreement" replacing this, a new customs agreement excluding the common external tariff and the EU ORG 's common commercial policy, an end to free movement of people, co-operation in crime and terrorism, collaboration in areas of science and technology, engagement with devolved administrations, maintaining the Common Travel Area ORG with Ireland GPE , and preserving existing workers' rights. She also confirmed, "that the Government will put the final deal that is agreed between the UK GPE and the EU ORG to a [meaningful] vote in both Houses of Parliament ORG , before it comes into force."[380] The Government ORG has stated its intention to "secure the specific interests of Scotland GPE , Wales GPE and Northern Ireland GPE , as well as those of all parts of England GPE ". Through the Joint Ministerial Committee ORG on EU Negotiations ORG (JMC(EN)), the Government ORG intends to involve the views of the Scottish Parliament ORG , the Welsh Assembly ORG and the Northern Ireland Assembly ORG in the process of negotiating the UK GPE 's exit from the EU ORG . For instance, at the January 2017 DATE meeting of the JMC(EN), the Scottish Government's ORG proposal to remain in the European Economic Area ORG was considered.[381]
Public comment pre- and post-Article 50 notification EU PRODUCT negotiator Guy Verhofstadt PERSON , the European NORP parliament's chief negotiator, said that: "All British NORP citizens today DATE have also EU ORG citizenship. That means a number of things: the possibility to participate in the European NORP elections, the freedom of travel without problem inside the union. We need to have an arrangement in which this arrangement can continue for those citizens who on an individual basis are requesting it." The suggestion being an associate citizenship.[382]
An EU ORG meeting to discuss Brexit GPE was called for 29 April 2017 DATE , Donald Tusk PERSON stating that the "priority would be giving "clarity" to EU ORG residents, business and member states about the talks ahead". Barnier PERSON called for talks to be completed by October 2018 DATE to give time for any agreement to be ratified before the UK GPE leaves in March 2019.[383 DATE ] Sinn Fin PERSON called for a referendum to create a united Ireland GPE , following the Northern Ireland GPE majority decision ( 56% to 44% PERCENT ) to vote no to Brexit GPE and 2 March DATE election to the Northern Ireland Assembly ORG wherein Sinn Fin ORG increased its number of seats.[384]
In early May DATE , Jean-Claude Juncker ORG said that the UK GPE leaving the EU ORG was a "tragedy" and that it is partly the responsibility of the EU ORG . "The EU ORG , in many respects has done too much, especially the Commission", including "too much regulation and too many interferences in the lives of our fellow citizens". The European Commission ORG has, following the "Better regulation" initiative, in place since before Brexit GPE , reduced the number of legislative proposals from 130 CARDINAL to 23 CARDINAL per year.[385][386]

13 CARDINAL Jul 2016

Terminology and etymology
In the wake of the referendum of 23 June 2016 DATE , many new pieces of Brexit ORG -related jargon have entered popular use.
BackstopA term referring to the government's proposal to keep Northern Ireland GPE in some aspects of the European Union Customs Union ORG and of the European Single Market ORG to prevent a hard border in Ireland GPE , so as not to compromise the Good Friday Agreement LAW . (See Irish NORP border question.) In principle, it is a temporary measure while the United Kingdom GPE identifies and develops a technology that operates customs, excise and other controls as between the UK GPE and the EU GPE , without any evident border infrastructure, and there must be compliance with section 10 CARDINAL of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act ORG 2018 DATE , on " Continuation of North- WORK_OF_ART South co-operation and the prevention of new border arrangements."
Blind/Blindfold BrexitCoined in September 2018 DATE to describe a scenario where the UK GPE leaves the EU GPE without clarity on the terms of a future trade deal.[400][401] EU GPE and British NORP negotiators would then have until 31 December 2020 DATE to sign off on a future trade deal, during which time the UK GPE will effectively remain a member of the EU ORG , but with no voting rights.[402][403]
BrexitBrexit (like its early variant, Brixit)[404] is a portmanteau of " British NORP " and "exit". The first ORDINAL attestation in the Oxford English LANGUAGE Dictionary is a Euractiv PERSON blog post by Peter Wilding PERSON on 15 May 2012.[405][406][407 DATE ] It was coined by analogy with " Grexit WORK_OF_ART ", attested on 6 February 2012 DATE to refer to a hypothetical withdrawal of Greece GPE from the eurozone (and possibly also the EU).[408] At present, Brexit GPE is impending under the EU Treaties LAW and the UK GPE Acts of Parliament ORG , and the current negotiations pursuant thereto.[409][407]
Brexiteer/ BrexiterThose ORG supporting Brexit ORG are sometimes referred to as "Brexiteers",[410][411] or " Brexiters".[412 PRODUCT ] Alternatively, the term " Leavers WORK_OF_ART " has also been used in media outlets.[413][414 ORDINAL ] Canada ORG plusThis is shorthand for a model where the United Kingdom GPE leaves the European Union ORG and signs a free trade agreement. This would allow the UK GPE to control its own trade policy with non- EU ORG countries, but would require rules of origin agreements to be reached for UK GPE EU ORG trade. It is likely this would lead to trade being less "free" than joining the EFTA ORG , and result in additional border controls being required, which is an issue of contention, particularly in Ireland GPE . The Canadian NORP European Union ORG deal took seven years DATE to negotiate, but Brexiteers PERSON argue it would take much less time between the UK GPE and EU GPE as the two CARDINAL participants already align on regulatory standards.[415] Chequers PERSON planThe short name given by the media to The framework for the future relationship between the United Kingdom GPE and the European Union ORG , the government's white paper drawn up at Chequers ORG and published on 12 July 2018 DATE which set out the sort of relationship the UK GPE government wanted with the EU ORG after Brexit.[416][417] On 22 November 2018 DATE the government published the updated draft.[418 LAW ]
Divorce billIt is expected that the UK GPE will make a contribution toward financial commitments that it approved while still a member of the EU ORG , but are still outstanding. In the first ORDINAL phase of negotiations the total amount was referred to as the single financial settlement, or just the settlement. Especially in the media, this has been called an exit bill or divorce bill, while the EU ORG talk of settling the accounts.[419] While serving as Brexit ORG Secretary, Dominic Raab PERSON said the UK GPE will not pay its financial settlement to the EU ORG in a no-deal scenario.[420] The Withdrawal Agreement ORG published in November 2018 DATE states that the financial contribution will be 39billion MONEY .
Hard and soft Brexit"Hard Brexit ORG " and "soft Brexit FAC " are unofficial terms that are commonly used by news media[421] to describe the prospective relationship between the UK GPE and the EU ORG after withdrawal. A hard Brexit ORG (also called a no-deal Brexit ORG ) usually refers to the UK GPE leaving the EU ORG and the European Single Market ORG with few or no deals (trade or otherwise) in place, meaning that trade will be conducted under the World Trade Organization's ORG rules, and services will no longer be provided by agencies of the European Union ORG (such as aviation safety).[422] Soft Brexit GPE encompasses any deal that involves retaining membership in the European Single Market ORG and at least some free movement of people according to European Economic Area ORG ( EEA ORG ) rules.[423] Theresa ORG May DATE 's " Chequers WORK_OF_ART plan" embraced some aspects of a "soft" Brexit.[424] Note that the EEA ORG and the deal with Switzerland GPE contain fully free movement of people, and that the EU GPE has wanted that to be included in a deal with UK GPE on fully free trade.
Meaningful voteA "meaningful vote" is a vote under section 13 LAW ( 2 CARDINAL ) of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act ORG 2018 DATE , requiring the government to arrange for a motion proposing approval of the outcome of negotiations with the EU ORG to be debated and voted on by the House of Commons ORG before the European Parliament ORG decides whether it consents to the withdrawal agreement being concluded on behalf of the EU ORG in accordance with Article 50(2) of the Treaty on European Union.[425 LAW ]
Managed no-deal"Managed no-deal Brexit"[426] or "managed no deal Brexit"[427] was increasingly used near the end of 2018 DATE , in respect of the complex series of political, legal and technical decisions needed if there is no withdrawal agreement treaty with the EU ORG when the UK GPE exits under the Article LAW 50 CARDINAL withdrawal notice.
Norway GPE model or Norway GPE plusThis is shorthand for a model where the United Kingdom GPE leaves the European Union ORG but becomes a member of the European Free Trade Association ORG (EFTA) and the European Economic Area ORG , possibly with the addition of a customs union ("plus"). EFTA and EEA ORG membership would allow the UK GPE to remain in the single market but without having to be subject to the Common Fisheries Policy, Common Agricultural Policy ORG , and the European Court of Justice ORG . The UK GPE would be subject to the EFTA ORG court, which largely shadows the ECJ PRODUCT , have to transfer a large amount of EU ORG law into UK GPE law, and have little say on shaping EU ORG rules (some of which the UK GPE will be compelled to take on). The UK GPE would also have to allow freedom of movement between the EU GPE and UK GPE , something that was seen as a key issue of contention in the referendum.[428]
RemainerThose in favour of the UK GPE remaining in the EU ORG are sometimes referred to as "Remainers".[429] The derogatory term " Remoaner WORK_OF_ART " (a portmanteau of "remainer" and "moaner") is sometimes used by pro- Brexit ORG media outlets.[430][431 PERSON ] Cultural ORG references Main ORG article: Brexit FAC in popular culture Visual arts ORG
Anti-Brexit protesters in Manchester GPE
Dsseldorf GPE carnival parade in February 2018 DATE
The response of artists and writers to Brexit GPE has in general been negative, reflecting a reported overwhelming percentage of people involved in Britain GPE 's creative industries voting against leaving the European NORP Union.[432]
Responses by visual artists to Brexit GPE include a mural, painted in May 2017 DATE , by the secretive graffiti artist Banksy PERSON near the ferry port at Dover GPE in southern England GPE . It shows a workman using a chisel to chip off one of the stars on the European Union Flag.[433 ORG ]
In his 2017 DATE art exhibition at the Serpentine Gallery FAC in London GPE , the artist Grayson Perry PERSON showed a series of ceramic, tapestry and other works of art dealing with the divisions in Britain GPE during the Brexit GPE campaign and in its aftermath. This included two CARDINAL large ceramic pots, Perry PERSON called his Brexit Vases ORG , standing on plinths ten feet QUANTITY apart, on the first ORDINAL of which were scenes involving pro- European British NORP citizens, and on the second ORDINAL scenes involving anti- European British NORP citizens. These were derived from what Perry PERSON called his " Brexit GPE tour of Britain."[434]
Novels
Ali Smith's PERSON 2016 DATE novel Autumn EVENT has been described by the Financial Times ORG as the first ORDINAL serious Brexit ORG novel.[435]
One CARDINAL of the first ORDINAL novels to engage with a post- Brexit Britain GPE was Rabbitman PERSON by Michael Paraskos PERSON (published 9 CARDINAL March 2017 DATE ). Rabbitman PERSON is a dark comic fantasy in which the events that lead to the election of a right-wing populist American NORP president, who happens also to be a rabbit, and Britain GPE 's vote to leave the European Union ORG , were the result of a series of Faustian NORP pacts with the Devil PERSON . As a result, Rabbitman PERSON is set partly in a post- Brexit Britain GPE in which society has collapsed and people are dependent on European Union ORG food aid.[436 GPE ]
Mark Billingham's PERSON Love Like Blood WORK_OF_ART (published 1 June 2017 DATE ) is a crime thriller in which Brexit ORG sees a rise in xenophobic hate crime.[437] In the novel The Remains of the Way WORK_OF_ART (published 6 June 2017 DATE ), David Boyle PERSON imagines Brexit ORG was a conspiracy led by a forgotten government quango, still working away in Whitehall GPE , originally set up by Thomas Cromwell PERSON in the 16th century DATE during the reign of King Henry VIII PERSON , and now dedicated to a Protestant NORP Brexit.[438]
Post- Brexit Britain GPE is also the setting for Amanda Craig's PERSON The Lie of the Land WORK_OF_ART (published 13 CARDINAL June 2017 DATE ), a satirical novel set ten years DATE after the vote to leave the European Union ORG , in which an impoverished middle class couple from Islington GPE in north London GPE are forced to move from the heart of the pro- European Union ORG capital, to the heart of the pro- Brexit GPE countryside in Devon.[439 ORG ] Brexit ORG is also the baseline for Douglas Board's ORG comic political thriller Time of Lies ORG (published 23 June 2017 DATE ). In this novel, the first ORDINAL post- Brexit FAC general election in 2020 DATE is won by a violent right-wing former football hooligan called Bob Grant PERSON . Board charts the response to this of the hitherto pro- European Union ORG metropolitan political elite.[440] Stanley Johnson's ORG Kompromat ( ORG published 13 CARDINAL July 2017 DATE ) is a political thriller that suggests the vote to leave the European Union ORG was a result of Russian NORP influence on the referendum, although Johnson PERSON has insisted his book is not intended to point the finger at Russia GPE 's secret services, but is "just meant to be fun."[441]
Jonathan Coe's PERSON Middle England LOC (published 8 CARDINAL November 2018 DATE ) is a state-of-the-nation novel which re-introduces some of the author's earlier characters from The Rotters' Club ( 2001 DATE ) and The Closed Circle WORK_OF_ART ( 2004 DATE ), and moves from the election of the coalition government in 2010 DATE , through the riots of 2011 DATE , the 2012 Olympics EVENT , the 2016 DATE referendum and its aftermath, ending in 2018.[442] Theatre PRODUCT In June 2017 DATE , the National Theatre in London ORG presented a play by Carol Ann Duffy PERSON , entitled My Country ORG ; a work in progress. An allegorical work, the play uses the device of a convention called by the goddess Britannia GPE , who is concerned about the future of the British NORP people.[443] The play differs from some artistic responses in that Duffy PERSON and the National Theatre FAC -based the attitudes of the characters in part on the responses of ordinary people in interviews that were conducted by the regional offices of the UK Arts Councils ORG , but excluding responses from London GPE and the south-east of England GPE , where most people voted not to leave the EU GPE . As a result, according to Dominic Cavendish PERSON , writing in The Daily Telegraph ORG , "the bias is towards the Leave camp".[444]
Film
In 2016 DATE , the television director Martin Durkin PERSON wrote and directed an 81-minute long documentary film titled Brexit ORG : The Movie, which advocated with the withdrawal of the United Kingdom GPE from the European Union ORG . The film was produced by the production company Wag TV ORG with a budget of 300,000.[445 MONEY ] The production costs were sourced primarily through crowdfunding via Kickstarter ORG alongside a 50,000 MONEY contribution from the hedge fund Spitfire Capital.[citation ORG needed] In May 2016 DATE the film premiered in Leicester Square FAC , with notable figures such as Nigel Farage PERSON and David Davis PERSON (who later became Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union ORG ) in attendance.
A documentary film was released in 2018 DATE , called Postcards PRODUCT from the 48% PERCENT , which is described on the film's website as: "A documentary film made by and featuring those who voted Remain, the 48% ORG , to show the other 27 CARDINAL EU GPE Member States GPE that it was far from a landslide victory and just why we are fighting to stay part of the EU."[446] A review on Shadows on the Wall[447] wrote: "This is a comprehensive, factual exploration of the issue, grappling with the referendum, its ramifications and the way the split vote has fractured British NORP society."[448]
A television drama film written by James Graham PERSON and directed by Toby Haynes PERSON , named Brexit ORG : The Uncivil War EVENT (simply Brexit ORG in the US GPE ), was released in January DATE 2019.[449] It depicts the lead-up to the 2016 DATE referendum through the activities of the strategists behind the Vote Leave campaign, that prompted the United Kingdom GPE to exit the European Union.[450 ORG ] It aired on Channel 4 in the United Kingdom GPE on 7 January DATE , and aired on HBO ORG in the United States GPE on 19 CARDINAL January.[451] Benedict Cumberbatch PERSON stars as Dominic Cummings PERSON , the Campaign Director of the official designated Brexit ORG -supporting group, Vote Leave.[452] Establishment ORG of pro- European NORP political organisations
Following the Brexit GPE vote, there have been several attempts to set up a new pro- European NORP political party.[453][454 PERSON ] Examples include 'The Democrats NORP ' (a proposal by former Daily Mail ORG political editor James Chapman PERSON ), 'The Radicals' (proposed by Jeremy Cliffe PERSON , former Berlin GPE bureau chief of The Economist ORG ), the Renew Britain GPE party,[454] the Advance Together party and United for Change ORG . So far, none of these parties have had any candidates elected.
In 2017 DATE , newly elected Liberal Democrats NORP leader Vince Cable PERSON criticised 'pop up' anti- Brexit FAC parties formed following the 2016 DATE referendum, saying of those groups' policies "...it is the kind of ideology-free, technocratic, authoritarian centrism that would be more at home in, say, Singapore GPE " and "Voters beware."[455] See ORG also Book WORK_OF_ART : BrexitBook ORG : Brexit ORG , Article 50 CARDINAL , and other articles

Quotes: "We find that fundamental characteristics of the voting population were key drivers of the Vote Leave share, in particular their education profiles, their historical dependence on manufacturing employment as well as low income and high unemployment. Reuters ORG . 2 CARDINAL February 2018 DATE . Retrieved 13 CARDINAL February DATE 2019.1 CARDINAL 2 " European Union (Withdrawal ORG ) Act 2018 DATE ". legislation.gov.uk. 2018 DATE . sec. 20(1 CARDINAL ). Retrieved 13 CARDINAL February 2019 DATE . exit day means 29 CARDINAL March 2019 DATE at 11.00 p.m.(and see subsections ( 2 CARDINAL ) to ( 5 CARDINAL )); Subsections PERSON ( 2 CARDINAL ) to ( 5 CARDINAL ) provide the option of amending the date by a Ministerial Regulation LAW "if the day DATE or time on or at which the Treaties are to cease to apply to the United Kingdom GPE in accordance with Article 50(3) of the Treaty on European Union LAW is different from that specified in the definition of exit day in subsection (1)." Article 50(3) of the Treaty on European Union WORK_OF_ART states: The Treaties shall cease to apply to the State ORG in question from the date of entry into force of the withdrawal agreement or, failing that, two years DATE after the notification referred to in paragraph 2 CARDINAL , unless the European Council ORG , in agreement with the Member State ORG concerned, unanimously decides to extend this period. The UK GPE legislation states the day and hour DATE as " 29 March 2019 DATE at 11.00 p.m. TIME " in the knowledge that the UK Interpretation Act LAW 1978 s.4 DATE (a) prescribes that "An Act or provision of an Act comes into force where provision is made for it to come into force on a particular day DATE , at the beginning of that day". Baldwin PERSON , Richard PERSON ( 31 July 2016 DATE ). " Brexit Beckons: Thinking WORK_OF_ART ahead by leading economists". VoxEU.org. Retrieved 22 CARDINAL November 2017 DATE . On 23 June 2016 DATE , 52% PERCENT of British NORP voters decided that being the first ORDINAL country ever to leave the EU ORG was a price worth paying for 'taking back control', despite advice from economists clearly showing that Brexit GPE would make the UK GPE 'permanently poorer' ( HM Treasury PRODUCT 2016 DATE ). The extent of agreement among economists on the costs of Brexit GPE was extraordinary: forecast after forecast supported similar conclusions (which have so far proved accurate in the aftermath of the Brexit FAC vote).1 2 " Brexit FAC survey". igmchicago.org. Retrieved 1 November DATE 2017.1 2 " Brexit GPE survey II". igmchicago.org. Retrieved 1 November 2017.1 2 DATE Sodha ORG , Sonia PERSON ; Helm PERSON , Toby PERSON ; Inman PERSON , Phillip PERSON ( 28 CARDINAL May 2016 DATE ). "Economists overwhelmingly reject Brexit ORG in boost for Cameron ORG ". The Observer. ISSN0029-7712. Retrieved 1 CARDINAL November 2017. "Most economists still pessimistic about effects of Brexit FAC ". Financial Times ORG . Retrieved 22 CARDINAL November 2017.1 DATE 2 3 DATE " Subscribe WORK_OF_ART to read". Financial Times ORG . Retrieved 22 CARDINAL November 2017 DATE . Unlike the short-term effects of Brexit GPE , which have been better than most had predicted, most economists say the ultimate impact of leaving the EU ORG still appears likely to be more negative than positive. But the one CARDINAL thing almost all agree upon is that no one will know how big the effects are for some time. Wren-Lewis PERSON , Simon PERSON . "Why is the academic consensus on the cost of Brexit FAC being ignored?". The Conversation. Retrieved 22 CARDINAL November DATE 2017. " Brexit GPE to Hit Jobs, Wealth and Output for Years DATE to Come, Economists Say". Bloomberg L.P. ORG 22 February 2017 DATE . Retrieved 22 CARDINAL November 2017 DATE . The U.K. GPE economy may be paying for Brexit GPE for a long time to come... It won't mean Armageddon ORG , but the broad consensus among economists whose predictions about the initial fallout were largely too pessimistic is for a prolonged effect that will ultimately diminish output, jobs and wealth to some degree. " Andy Haldane PERSON is wrong: there is no crisis in economics". Financial Times. Carter PERSON , Andrew PERSON ; Swinney PERSON , Paul PERSON . " Brexit FAC and the Future of the UK GPE 's Unbalanced Economic Geography ORG ". The Political Quarterly ORG . 0 CARDINAL (0). doi:10.1111/1467-923X.12649. ISSN 1467 CARDINAL -923X. What all of these studies agree on is that whichever Brexit ORG deal is struck, even the most advantageous will have a negative impact on future economic growth for all places across the UK GPE in the short to medium term. And they also agree that over the longer term its places that are already struggling that are likely to struggle the most, further exacerbating the country's unbalanced economic geography. DATE Hauliers face lottery for permits in no-deal Brexit FAC DATE The Guardian ORG , 5 CARDINAL November DATE 2018 Turkey GPE border gridlock hints at pain to come for Brexit Britain GPE : Truck drivers bemoan long queues and endless paperwork needed to enter EU The Financial Times ORG , 16 February 2017 DATE , by Mehul Srivastava PERSON and Alex Barker1 2 PERSON "Getting to Europe Post ORG Brexit - The Impact on Ferry Companies". Atc ORG -logistics.ie. 23 April DATE 2018.1 2 McClean PERSON , Paul PERSON ( 30 May 2017 DATE ). "After Brexit FAC : the UK GPE will need to renegotiate at least 759 CARDINAL treaties". Financial Times ORG . Retrieved 31 CARDINAL May 2017 DATE . (Subscription required (help)). Through analysis of the EU ORG treaty database, the FT found 759 CARDINAL separate EU ORG bilateral agreements with potential relevance to Britain GPE , covering trade in nuclear goods, customs, fisheries, trade, transport and regulatory co-operation in areas such as antitrust or financial services. This includes multilateral agreements based on consensus, where Britain GPE must re-approach 132 CARDINAL separate parties. Around 110 CARDINAL separate opt-in accords at the UN ORG and World Trade Organization ORG are excluded from the estimates, as are narrow agreements on the environment, health, research and science. Some additional UK GPE bilateral deals, outside the EU GPE framework, may also need to be revised because they make reference to EU ORG law. Some of the 759 CARDINAL are so essential that it would be unthinkable to operate without them. Air services agreements allow British NORP aeroplanes to land in America GPE , Canada GPE or Israel GPE ; nuclear accords permit the trade in spare parts and fuel for Britain GPE 's power stations. Both these sectors are excluded from trade negotiations and must be addressed separately. "Why Brexit may be good for terrorists and the Kremlin ORG and bad for European NORP security". " Brexit FAC : the exit bill" (PDF). House of Commons Library ORG . CBP-8039 ORG . Retrieved 15 CARDINAL February 2018 DATE . When the UK GPE leaves the EU ORG it is expected to make a contribution towards the EU ORG 's outstanding financial commitments spending that was agreed while the UK GPE was a member. The media have labelled this as an 'exit bill' or 'divorce bill', the EU ORG see it as a matter of 'settling the accounts'. The issue has been discussed in the first ORDINAL phase of Brexit GPE negotiations under the title of the 'single financial settlement' (the settlement). "PM to discuss no-deal Brexit ORG plans". Authority ORG control BNF PRODUCT : cb17123335x (data) GND PRODUCT : 1109778066 CARDINAL

SUDOC ORG : 200582151

First Version¶

Required packages¶

In order to run the below-mentioned code below package is mandetory

  • wikipedia
  • To install wikipedia nltk packages use below command
    • pip install wikipedia
  • For more detail please go through the below link
    • https://pypi.org/project/wikipedia/
  • For more information about nltk ne_chunk go through the below links
    • https://www.nltk.org/api/nltk.chunk.html
    • https://www.kaggle.com/nltkdata/maxent-ne-chunker
  • To understand how perception tagger works please go through the below link.
    • http://www.nltk.org/_modules/nltk/tag/perceptron.html

How the program works¶

  • The program is divided into two parts which are as follows.
    • Named Entity Extraction from the fact
    • Verify the fact using the on-line Wikipedia

Named Entity Extraction from the fact¶

  • The program starts working with the fact (provided by the user).
  • The fact provided by the user is passed to the named entity extraction method of Fact class. The processing of given fact begins in this step.
  • Tokenized the fact using nltk.word_tokenize. After that tokenized fact passed to nltk.pos_tag for POS Tag.
  • After pre-processing (tokenization with POS Tag) of fact, it will use nltk ne_chunk method to return a tree of named entity.
  • Later it will pass to continuous chunk to extract the NE from the tree (for more detail how it works please go through the below link https://www.programcreek.com/python/example/91258/nltk.ne_chunk)
  • NER for given facts end here.

Verify the fact using the on-line Wikipedia¶

  • Once the named entity extraction from the facts (provided by the user) is done, the program fetches the Wikipedia pages for every entity of the fact (based on the user input) and stores all relevant pages in the memory.
  • When the necessary fetching is completed, the program will check whether the named entities of the fact occur on the same page or not.

  • After that it calculates the ratio between the common occurrences of both NEs and all comparisons for NEs. If the ratio is more than 0.80, the program will return the positive result otherwise it will return negative result.

    Whole Working process can be summarized as follows

  • Drawbacks of the program Below are some major drawbacks related to the program
    • If the NEs present in more than one Wikipedia pages, the program will return 0 as it will not able to decide which page need to fetch from the cache.
    • For NEs of same pages it will always return 1 regardless the actual realization between them.
In [10]:
import wikipedia
import nltk
import csv
from nltk.tree import Tree
nltk.download('averaged_perceptron_tagger')
nltk.download('maxent_ne_chunker')
nltk.download('words')
nltk.download('punkt')

In [11]:
class NamedEntityExtractionOfFact:
    def __init__(self):
        pass

    def extract_named_entities_fact(self, sentence):
        sentence_processing = self.sentences_pre_processing(sentence)

        ne_chunks = nltk.ne_chunk(sentence_processing, binary=True)
        list_of_named_entities = self.get_continuous_chunks(ne_chunks)
        
        #print(ne_chunks)
        #print(list_of_named_entities)

        return list_of_named_entities

    # Tokenize and POS for the Facts
    def sentences_pre_processing(self, sentence):
        sentence = sentence.replace('\'', ' ')
        sentence = nltk.word_tokenize(sentence)
        sentence = nltk.pos_tag(sentence)

        return sentence
    
    
   # Identify the NEs and form a tree of NEs for the preprossed facts
    @staticmethod
    def get_continuous_chunks(chunk):
        continuous_chunk = []
        current_chunk = []

        for c in chunk:
            # Create a tree for NEs
            if type(c) == Tree:
                current_chunk.append(" ".join([token for token, pos in c.leaves()]))
            elif current_chunk:
                named_entity = " ".join(current_chunk)
                if named_entity not in continuous_chunk:
                    continuous_chunk.append(named_entity)
                    current_chunk = []
            else:
                continue

        if continuous_chunk:
            named_entity = " ".join(current_chunk)    
            if named_entity not in continuous_chunk:
                continuous_chunk.append(named_entity)

        return continuous_chunk   # Extract the NEs from the tree

    def process_fact(self, fact):
        self.extract_named_entities_fact(fact)
In [12]:
# Identify and store the relevant wikipedia pages in the memory for every NEs of the fact

class WikipediaPageExtraction:

    def __init__(self):
        self.cache_wiki = {}
        pass

    def cached_wikipage_entity(self, entity):
        wikipages = None
        if entity in self.cache_wiki:
            wikipages = self.cache_wiki[entity]
        else:
            try:
                wikipages = wikipedia.page(entity)
            except wikipedia.exceptions.DisambiguationError:
                print("Disambiguation error: " + entity)
                wikipages = None
            except:
                print("Exception Occured : " + entity)
                wikipages = None

            self.cache_wiki[entity] = wikipages

        return wikipages
In [13]:
class FactCheckingUsingWikiPages:
    def __init__(self):
        self.fact_named_entity_extraction = NamedEntityExtractionOfFact()
        self.wikipedia_page_extractor = WikipediaPageExtraction()
        pass

    def fact_checking(self, fact):

        # get named entities
        named_entities = self.fact_named_entity_extraction.extract_named_entities_fact(fact)

        named_entities_with_pages = {}

        for entity in named_entities:
            named_entities_with_pages[entity] = self.wikipedia_page_extractor.cached_wikipage_entity(entity)

        count_of_common_occurence = 0
        total_num_of_occurences = 0
        entities_comparison = set()

        
        # Identify whether the NEs are from same pages
        for wiki_entity in named_entities:
            for fact_entity in named_entities:

                wiki_page = named_entities_with_pages[wiki_entity]

                if wiki_page is None:
                    continue

                wiki_and_fact_entities = wiki_entity + ',' + fact_entity
                wiki_and_fact_entities_reverse = fact_entity + ',' + wiki_entity

                if wiki_entity != fact_entity and not wiki_and_fact_entities in entities_comparison:

                    # check if entities exist together
                    if fact_entity in wiki_page.content:
                        count_of_common_occurence += 1

                    total_num_of_occurences += 1
                    entities_comparison.add(wiki_and_fact_entities)
                    entities_comparison.add(wiki_and_fact_entities_reverse)

        if total_num_of_occurences == 0:
            return 0.0
            
        #Calculate the ratio
        percentage_of_similarity = count_of_common_occurence / total_num_of_occurences

        if percentage_of_similarity > 0.8:
            return 1.0
            
        
            
            
        else:
            return 0.0
            
# Read the input files (Facts provided by the user)

def main():
    inputfile = "fact.tsv"
    fact_checking_wiki = FactCheckingUsingWikiPages()

    with open(inputfile, encoding="latin-1") as tsvfile:
        next(tsvfile)
        reader = csv.reader(tsvfile, delimiter='\t')
        
        i = 0

        for row in reader:
            if len(row) < 2:
                continue
            id = int(row[0])
            fact = row[1]

            estimated_val = float(fact_checking_wiki.fact_checking(fact))
            i += 1
            print(str(i) + ": " + str(estimated_val))
            


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

In [14]:
import re
import os
import nltk
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import csv, xlrd
from urllib import request
from nltk import sent_tokenize
from nltk import word_tokenize
from nltk.corpus import stopwords
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
from bs4.element import Tag
from nltk.corpus import wordnet as wn
from itertools import chain, groupby
from nltk.tag import StanfordNERTagger
from nltk.stem import WordNetLemmatizer
In [15]:
wikipedia_base = 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/'
#pronoun = ['he', 'she', 'his', 'her', 'their', 'He', 'She', 'His', 'Her', 'Their']
negtive_words = ['no', 'not']


def open_target_url(subject):
    return wikipedia_base + subject

def obtain_target_text(url):
    try:
        html = request.urlopen(url).read().decode('utf-8')
        bs = BeautifulSoup(html, features = 'html.parser')
        attrs = {"class": 'mw-parser-output'}
        need = bs.find(name = 'div', attrs = attrs)
        raw_text = ''
        for tag in need.contents:
            if tag.name == 'p' :
                raw_text += tag.text.strip() + '\n'
        header = ''
        stat = []
        counter = 0
        for tag in need.contents:
            if tag.name == 'table':
                for tbody in tag.contents:
                    if tbody.name == 'tbody':
                        for tr in tbody:
                            features = ''
                            contents = ''
                            if tr.name == 'tr': 
                                for th in tr:                 
                                    if th.name == 'th':
                                        if counter == 0:
                                            header = th.text
                                            counter += 1
                                        else:
                                            features = re.sub('\n', ' ', th.text)
                            
                                    if th.name == 'td':
                                        contents = re.sub('\n', ' ', th.text)
                                stat.append(header + ' is ' + features + ' of ' + contents + '.\n')  
        raw_text += ''.join(stat)
        return raw_text
    except Exception as e:
        print('Can not find the target page in Wikipeadia.',url)
        return

    
def nerInNLTK(text):
    text1 = re.sub('(\.|\'s|\')', '', text)
    try:
        st = StanfordNERTagger('.//NER_//english.all.3class.distsim.crf.ser.gz', './/NER_//stanford-ner.jar')
        result = st.tag(text1.split())
        return result
    except Exception as e:
        print('did not detect any person, organization or location, please check.')

def combo_ners(word_with_tags):
    entities = []
    relations = []
    for tag, chunk in groupby(word_with_tags, lambda x: x[1]): 
        if tag != 'O':      
            entities.append((tag, " ".join(w for w, t in chunk)))
        else:
            relations.append((tag, " ".join(w for w, t in chunk)))
    #print(entities)
    #print(relations)
    entities1 = []
    for entitie in entities:
        if entitie[0] == 'PERSON':
            entities1.append( ('PERSON',re.sub('(\.|\'s|\')', '', entitie[1])))
        if entitie[0] == 'LOCATION':
            entities1.append(('LOCATION', re.sub('\.', '', entitie[1])))
            
    return (entities1, relations)


def eliminate_symbols(inpt):
    return re.sub(r'[^\w]', ' ', inpt)
def eliminate_symbols_1(inpt):
    return re.sub(r'[^\w]', '', inpt)
def eliminate_annotations(inpt):
    return re.sub(r'\[\S*\]', '', inpt)


def pre_process(sent):
    key_facts = []
    sent_token = nltk.word_tokenize(sent)
    pos_taged = nltk.pos_tag(sent_token)
    for word, tag in pos_taged:
        if tag.startswith('N') or tag.startswith('J') or tag.startswith('V') or tag.startswith('R')or tag.startswith('C'):
            key_facts.append(word)
    return key_facts


def find_similar_word(pure_key_word):
    simis_word = []
    for word in pure_key_word:
        synsets = wn.synsets(word)
        for syn in synsets:
            for sy in syn.lemmas():
                simis_word.append(sy.name())
    simis_word += pure_key_word 
    return set(simis_word)

# natural language process . para1: the sequence of the html store in the url.txt

def pre_process1(words):
    sent_token = nltk.word_tokenize(words)
    patterns= [(r'.*ing$','VBG'),(r'.*ed$','VBD'),(r'.*es$','VBZ'),(r'.*ould$','MD'),\
           (r'.*\'s$','NN$'),(r'.*ly$','RB'),(r'.*s$','NNS'),(r'^-?[0-9]+(.[0-9]+)?$','CD'),(r'.*','NN')]
    regexp_tagger = nltk.RegexpTagger(patterns)
    pos_taged = regexp_tagger.tag(sent_token)
    wnl = WordNetLemmatizer()
    after = []
    for lemma in pos_taged:
        if lemma[1].startswith('N'):
            after.append(wnl.lemmatize(lemma[0],'n'))
            continue
        if lemma[1].startswith('J'):
            after.append(wnl.lemmatize(lemma[0], 'a'))
            continue
        if lemma[1].startswith('V'):
            after.append(wnl.lemmatize(lemma[0], 'v'))
            continue
        if lemma[1].startswith('R'):
            after.append(wnl.lemmatize(lemma[0], 'r'))
            continue
        else:
            after.append(wnl.lemmatize(lemma[0]))
    return after


def key_word_match(needed_text, entities, facts, confident_threshold):
    matched_sentences = []
    sentences = sent_tokenize(needed_text)
    pre_suf = entities.split()
    pre_suf.append(entities)
    pure_key_word = [fact for fact in facts if fact not in pre_suf]
    simis_word = find_similar_word(pure_key_word)
    for sentence in sentences:
        had_matched_word = []
        words = pre_process1(sentence)
        for word in words:
            if  word in simis_word:
                    had_matched_word.append(word)
        matched_lenth = len(set(had_matched_word))
        confidence = matched_lenth - confident_threshold
        neg_matched = [neg for neg in negtive_words if neg in had_matched_word]
        neg_input = [neg for neg in negtive_words if neg in facts]
        if len(pure_key_word) <= confidence and neg_input == neg_matched:
            matched_sentences.append(sentence)
            print('Mathched ',matched_lenth, 'keywords on:', ' '.join(words))
            print('Mathched words: ', set(had_matched_word))
    return matched_sentences        

# Imports the Google Cloud client library

from google.cloud import translate

def translation(traget_lan, sentence):    
    # Instantiates a client
    translate_client = translate.Client()
    # The text to translate
    text = sentence
    # Translates some text into Chinese
    translation = translate_client.translate(text, target_language=traget_lan)
    print(u'Translation: {}'.format(translation['translatedText']))
    return translation['translatedText']


def compare_translation_sent(sent1, sent2):
    sents1 = eliminate_symbols_1(sent1)
    sents2 = eliminate_symbols_1(sent2)
    sents_array_1 = [i for i in sents1]
    sents_array_2 = [j for j in sents2]
    counter = 0
    chunk_match_length = []
    for i in range(len(sents_array_2)):
        for j in range(len(sents_array_1)):
            if i <= (len(sents_array_2) - 1):
                if sents_array_2[i] == sents_array_1[j]:
                    counter += 1
                    chunk_match_length.append(counter) 
                    i += 1
                    continue
                else:
                    counter = 0
                    continue
    if len(chunk_match_length) > 0:
        match_accuracy = sorted(chunk_match_length, reverse = True)[0] / len(sents_array_2)
    else:
        match_accuracy = 0
    return match_accuracy    

# please use pip install xlrd here.
def read_csv_files(file_name):
    df = pd.read_excel(os.getcwd() +'//'+ file_name)
    stat = ['Fact_Statement']
    target = df[stat].values.astype(str).tolist()
    target1 = np.array(target).flatten()
    return target1
stat_lines = read_csv_files('Fact_Checking.xlsx')       
 
for line in stat_lines:
    print(line)
    #inputs_trans = translation('zh-CN', line)
    key_facts = pre_process(line)
    key_facts1 = pre_process1(' '.join(key_facts))
    # recognize person, location and org
    ners = nerInNLTK(line)
    entities = combo_ners(ners)[0]
    sent_mean = {}
    counter = 0;
    for entitie in entities:
        target_url = open_target_url(entitie[1])
        target_text = obtain_target_text(target_url)
        if target_text == None:
            break
        target_text_1 = eliminate_annotations(target_text)
        matched_sentences = key_word_match(target_text_1, entitie[1], key_facts1, 0)
        if len(matched_sentences) > 0:
            for sent in range(len(matched_sentences)):
                counter += 1
                print('Matched ', counter, ': ', matched_sentences[sent])
        else:
            print("No Matches", 'in Wikipedia page of', '\"', entitie[1],'.\"')
         
    print()

    #matched_trans = translation('zh-CN', sent)

    #sent_mean[sent] = mean_similarity
    #max_mean = sorted(sent_mean.items(), key=lambda item: item[1], reverse=True)[0]
    #if float(max_mean[1]) > 0.21 and counter == 0:
        #counter += 1
        #print('Matched the sentence with max semantic similarity of :', max_mean, end='\n\n')
    #else:
        #print('You maybe worng!', end='\n\n')
